simplification: In these formulations, the antimicrobial activity comes from ethanol or isopropanol.

original: Hydrogen peroxide is used to help eliminate bacterial spores in the alcohol; it is "not an active substance for hand antisepsis".
simplification: Hydrogen peroxide is used to help eliminate bacterial spores in the alcohol; it is "not an active substance for antiseptically cleaning the hands".

original: Glycerol is added as a humectant.
simplification: Glycerol is added as a humectant.

original: People are managed with supportive care, which may include fluid therapy, oxygen support, and supporting other affected vital organs.
simplification: People are managed with supportive care. Supportive care may include fluid therapy, oxygen support, and supporting other affected vital organs.

original: The CDC recommends that those who suspect they carry the virus wear a simple face mask.
simplification: The CDC recommends that those who think that they might carry the virus wear a simple face mask.

original: Extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) has been used to address the issue of respiratory failure, but its benefits are still under consideration.
simplification: Extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) has been used to treat the issue of respiratory failure, but its benefits are still under consideration.

original: Personal hygiene and a healthy lifestyle and diet have been recommended to improve immunity.
simplification: Personal hygiene and a healthy lifestyle have been recommended to improve immunity.

original: Supportive treatments may be useful in those with mild symptoms at the early stage of infection.The WHO and Chinese National Health Commission have published recommendations for taking care of people who are hospitalised with COVID-19.
simplification: Supportive treatments may be useful in those with mild symptoms at the early stage of infection. The WHO and Chinese National Health Commission have published recommendations for taking care of people who are hospitalised with COVID-19.

original: Intensivists and pulmonologists in the U.S. have compiled treatment recommendations from various agencies into a free resource, the IBCC.
simplification: Intensivists and pulmonologists in the U.S. have created a group of treatment recommendations from various agencies into a free resource, called the IBCC.

original: As of April 2020, there is no specific treatment for COVID-19.
simplification: As of April 2020, there is no specific treatment for COVID-19.

original: For symptoms, some medical professionals recommend paracetamol (acetaminophen) over ibuprofen for first-line use.
simplification: For symptoms, some medical professionals recommend paracetamol (acetaminophen) instead of ibuprofen for first-line use.

original: Precautions must be taken to minimise the risk of virus transmission, especially in healthcare settings when performing procedures that can generate aerosols, such as intubation or hand ventilation.
simplification: Precautions must be taken to minimise the risk of virus transmission. This is especially true in healthcare settings when performing procedures that can generate aerosols, such as intubation or hand ventilation.

original: For healthcare professionals caring for people with COVID-19, the CDC recommends placing the person in an Airborne Infection Isolation Room (AIIR) in addition to using standard precautions, contact precautions and airborne precautions.The CDC outlines the guidelines for the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) during the pandemic.
simplification: For healthcare professionals caring for people with COVID-19, the CDC recommends placing the person in an Airborne Infection Isolation Room (AIIR) in addition to using standard precautions, contact precautions and airborne precautions. The CDC outlines the guidelines for the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) during the pandemic.

original: The recommended gear is: PPE gown, respirator or facemask, eye protection, and medical gloves.When available, respirators (instead of facemasks) are preferred.
simplification: The recommended gear is: PPE gown, respirator or facemask, eye protection, and medical gloves. When available, respirators are preferred, instead of facemasks.

original: N95 respirators are approved for industrial settings but the FDA has authorised the masks for use under an Emergency Use Authorisation (EUA).
simplification: N95 respirators are approved for industrial settings, but the FDA has authorised the masks for use under an Emergency Use Authorisation (EUA).

original: They are designed to protect from airborne particles like dust but effectiveness against a specific biological agent is not guaranteed for off-label uses.
simplification: They are designed to protect from airborne particles, like dust, but effectiveness against specific biological agents is not guaranteed for off-label use.

original: When masks are not available, the CDC recommends using face shields or, as a last resort, homemade masks.
simplification: When masks are not available, the CDC recommends using face shields. As a last resort, homemade masks are an option.

original: Most cases of COVID-19 are not severe enough to require mechanical ventilation or alternatives, but a percentage of cases are.
simplification: Most cases of COVID-19 are not severe enough to require mechanical ventilation or alternatives, but some cases are.

original: The type of respiratory support for individuals with COVID-19 related respiratory failure is being actively studied for people in hospital, with some evidence that intubation can be avoided with a high flow nasal cannula or bi-level positive airway pressure.
simplification: The type of respiratory support for individuals with COVID-19 related respiratory failure is being actively studied for people in hospital. Some evidence states that intubation can be avoided with a high flow nasal cannula or bi-level positive airway pressure.

original: Whether either of these two leads to the same benefit for people who are critically ill is not known.
simplification: It is unknown whether either of these two lead to the same benefit for people who are critically ill.

original: Some doctors prefer staying with invasive mechanical ventilation when available because this technique limits the spread of aerosol particles compared to a high flow nasal cannula.Severe cases are most common in older adults (those older than 60 years, and especially those older than 80 years).
simplification: Some doctors prefer staying with invasive mechanical ventilation when available because this technique limits the spread of aerosol particles compared to a high flow nasal cannula. Severe cases are most common in those older than 60 years, and especially those older than 80 years.

original: Many developed countries do not have enough hospital beds per capita, which limits a health system's capacity to handle a sudden spike in the number of COVID-19 cases severe enough to require hospitalisation.
simplification: Many developed countries do not have enough hospital beds for each person, which limits a health system's capacity to handle a spike in the number of COVID-19 cases severe enough to require hospitalisation.

original: One study in China found 5% were admitted to intensive care units, 2.3% needed mechanical support of ventilation, and 1.4% died.
simplification: One study in China found 5% were admitted to intensive care units, 2.3% needed mechanical support of ventilation, and 1.4% died.

original: In China, approximately 30% of people in hospital with COVID-19 are eventually admitted to ICU.
simplification: In China, about 30% of people in hospital with COVID-19 are eventually admitted to ICU.

original: Mechanical ventilation becomes more complex as acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) develops in COVID-19 and oxygenation becomes increasingly difficult.
simplification: Mechanical ventilation becomes more difficult as acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) develops in COVID-19, and oxygenation becomes increasingly difficult.

original: Ventilators capable of pressure control modes and high PEEP are needed to maximise oxygen delivery while minimising the risk of ventilator-associated lung injury and pneumothorax.
simplification: Ventilators capable of pressure control modes and high PEEP are needed to maximise oxygen delivery, while also minimising the risk of ventilator-associated lung injury and pneumothorax.

original: High PEEP may not be available on older ventilators.
simplification: High PEEP may not be available on older ventilators.

original: Research into potential treatments started in January 2020, and several antiviral drugs are in clinical trials.
simplification: Research into potential treatments started in January 2020, and some antiviral drugs are in clinical trials.

original: Remdesivir appears to be the most promising.
simplification: Remdesivir seems to be the most promising.

original: Although new medications may take until 2021 to develop, several of the medications being tested are already approved for other uses or are already in advanced testing.
simplification: New medications may take until 2021 to develop, but several of the medications being tested are already approved for other uses or are already in advanced testing.

original: Antiviral medication may be tried in people with severe disease.
simplification: Antiviral medication may be tried in people with severe disease.

original: The WHO recommended volunteers take part in trials of the effectiveness and safety of potential treatments.The FDA has granted temporary authorisation to convalescent plasma as an experimental treatment in cases where the person's life is seriously or immediately threatened.
simplification: The WHO recommended volunteers take part in trials of the effectiveness and safety of potential treatments. The FDA has granted temporary authorisation to convalescent plasma as an experimental treatment in cases where the person's life is seriously threatened.

original: It has not undergone the clinical studies needed to show it is safe and effective for the disease.
simplification: It has not been through the clinical studies needed to show it is safe and effective for the disease.

original: In February 2020, China launched a mobile app to deal with the disease outbreak.
simplification: In February 2020, China released a mobile app to deal with the disease outbreak.

original: Users are asked to enter their name and ID number.
simplification: Users are asked to enter their name and ID number.

original: The app is able to detect 'close contact' using surveillance data and therefore a potential risk of infection.
simplification: The app is able to detect 'close contact' and therefore a potential risk of infection.

original: Every user can also check the status of three other users.
simplification: Every user can also check the status of 3 other users.

original: If a potential risk is detected, the app not only recommends self-quarantine, it also alerts local health officials.Big data analytics on cellphone data, facial recognition technology, mobile phone tracking and artificial intelligence are used to track infected people and people whom they contacted in South Korea, Taiwan and Singapore.
simplification: If a potential risk is detected, the app recommends self-quarantine and alerts local health officials. Big data analytics on facial recognition technology, mobile phone tracking and artificial intelligence are used to track infected people and people who they have contacted in South Korea, Taiwan and Singapore.

original: In March 2020, the Israeli government enabled security agencies to track mobile phone data of people supposed to have coronavirus.
simplification: In March 2020, the Israeli government enabled security agencies to track mobile phone data of people who probably have coronavirus.

original: The measure was taken to enforce quarantine and protect those who may come into contact with infected citizens.
simplification: The measure was taken to enforce quarantine and protect those who may come into contact with infected people

original: Also in March 2020, Deutsche Telekom shared aggregated phone location data with the German federal government agency, Robert Koch Institute, in order to research and prevent the spread of the virus.
simplification: Deutsche Telekom shared aggregated phone location data with the German federal government agency, Robert Koch Institute, in order to research and prevent the spread of the virus.

original: Russia deployed facial recognition technology to detect quarantine breakers.
simplification: Russia used facial recognition technology to detect quarantine breakers.

original: Italian regional health commissioner Giulio Gallera said he has been informed by mobile phone operators that "40% of people are continuing to move around anyway".
simplification: Italian regional health commissioner, Giulio Gallera, said he has been informed by mobile phone operators that "40% of people are continuing to move around anyway".

original: German government conducted a 48 hours weekend hackathon with more than 42.000 participants.
simplification: German government conducted a 48 hours weekend 'hackathon' with more than 42.000 participants.

original: Also the president of Estonia, Kersti Kaljulaid, made a global call for creative solutions against the spread of coronavirus.
simplification: Also the president of Estonia, Kersti Kaljulaid, made a global call for creative solutions against the spread of coronavirus.

original: Individuals may experience distress from quarantine, travel restrictions, side effects of treatment or fear of the infection itself.
simplification: Individuals may experience distress from quarantine, travel restrictions, side effects of treatment or fear of the infection.

original: BBC quoted Rory O'Connor in saying, "Increased social isolation, loneliness, health anxiety, stress and an economic downturn are a perfect storm to harm people's mental health and wellbeing."
simplification: BBC quoted Rory O'Connor in saying, "Increased social isolation, loneliness, health anxiety, stress and an economic downturn are going to harm people's mental health and wellbeing."

original: The disease may take a mild course with few or no symptoms, resembling other common upper respiratory diseases such as the common cold.
simplification: The disease may take a mild course with few or no symptoms, resembling other common upper respiratory diseases.

original: Mild cases typically recover within two weeks, while those with severe or critical diseases may take three to six weeks to recover.
simplification: Mild cases typically recover within 2 weeks. Those with severe or critical diseases may take 3 to 6 weeks to recover.

original: Pregnant women may be at higher risk for severe infection with COVID-19 based on data from other similar viruses, like SARS and MERS, but data for COVID-19 is lacking.In some people, COVID-19 may affect the lungs causing pneumonia.
simplification: Pregnant women may be at higher risk for severe infection with COVID-19. This is based on data from other similar viruses, like SARS and MERS, but data for COVID-19 is lacking. In some people, COVID-19 may affect the lungs causing pneumonia.

original: On 28 March 2020, the FDA issued an emergency use authorisation for hydroxychloroquine and chloroquine at the discretion of physicians treating people with COVID-19. The Chinese 7th edition guidelines also include interferon, ribavirin or umifenovir for use against COVID-19.
simplification: On 28 March 2020, the FDA issued an emergency use authorisation for hydroxychloroquine and chloroquine at the discretion of physicians treating people with COVID-19. The Chinese 7th edition guidelines also include interferon, ribavirin or umifenovir for use against COVID-19.

original: Preliminary data indicate that high doses of ribavirin are necessary to inhibit SARS-CoV-2 in vitro.
simplification: Early data indicate that high doses of ribavirin are necessary to inhibit SARS-CoV-2 in vitro.

original: Nitazoxanide has been recommended for further in vivo study after demonstrating low concentration inhibition of SARS-CoV-2.Studies have demonstrated that initial spike protein priming by transmembrane protease serine 2 (TMPRSS2) is essential for entry of SARS-CoV-2 via interaction with the ACE2 receptor.
simplification: Nitazoxanide has been recommended for further in vivo study after demonstrating low concentration inhibition of SARS-CoV-2. Studies have shown that initial spike protein priming by transmembrane protease serine 2 (TMPRSS2) is essential for entry of SARS-CoV-2 via interaction with the ACE2 receptor.

original: The studies of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine with or without azithromycin have major limitations that have prevented the medical community from embracing these therapies without further study.Oseltamivir does not inhibit SARS-CoV-2 in vitro and has no known role in COVID-19 treatment.
simplification: The studies of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine with or without azithromycin have major limitations that have prevented the medical community from using these therapies without further study. Oseltamivir does not inhibit SARS-CoV-2 in vitro, and has no known role in COVID-19 treatment.

original: Cytokine storm can be a complication in the later stages of severe COVID-19.
simplification: Cytokine storm can be a complication in the later stages of severe COVID-19.

original: Bangladesh reports five new deaths due to COVID-19, a daily highest
simplification: Bangladesh reports 5 new deaths from COVID-19, which is their daily highest.

original: Yesterday, Bangladesh has confirmed five new deaths due to COVID-19 on the day.
simplification: Yesterday, Bangladesh confirmed 5 new COVID-19 deaths

original: This is the highest number of fatalities in a day due to the virus.
simplification: This is the highest number of deaths in one day due to COVID-19.

original: As of yesterday, Bangladesh's Institute of Epidemiology, Disease Control and Research (IEDCR) reported the number of recorded infected cases included 114 active cases and 33 recovered cases who were staying home.
simplification: Bangladesh's Institute of Epidemiology, Disease Control and Research (IEDCR) reported that, as of yesterday, the number of recorded infected cases included 114 active cases and 33 recovered cases.

original: A total of 17 deaths have been recorded.
simplification: A total of 17 deaths have been recorded.

original: In an online news briefing, the director of IEDCR, Dr Meerjady Sabrina Flora, said the fatalities included four males and one female.
simplification: In an online news briefing, the director of IEDCR, Dr Meerjady Sabrina Flora, said the deaths included 4 males and 1 female.

original: According to Dr Meerjady, two cases were aged above 60, two between 51 and 60, and one 41-50 years old.
simplification: According to Dr Meerjady, two cases were aged above 60. Also, two between 51 and 60, and one 41-50 years old.

original: She also said two of the victims were from Dhaka.
simplification: She also said two of the people affected were from Dhaka

original: The World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic on March 11.
simplification: The World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic on March 11.

original: A hospital official told Anadolu Agency, a local news outlet, that one of the deceased was Jalal Saifur Rahman, a director of Bengali Anti-Corruption Commission, who was cared for at the Kuwait Maitree Hospital.
simplification: A hospital official told Anadolu Agency that one of the deceased was Jalal Saifur Rahman, a director of Bengali Anti-Corruption Commission, who was cared for at the Kuwait Maitree Hospital.

original: On Saturday, in an online video announcement, Bangladeshi Road Transport and Bridges Minister Obaidul Quader said public transport would be shut down for longer than initially planned, until this coming Saturday.
simplification: On Saturday Bangladeshi Road Transport and Bridges Minister Obaidul Quader said that public transport would be shut down for longer than initially planned, until this coming Saturday.

original: This public transport shutdown had initially started on March 26 and was planned to end on Saturday, April 4.
simplification: This public transport shutdown had initially started on March 26th and was planned to end on April 4th.

original: Transport of essential goods -- medical, fuel and food -- was still allowed.
simplification: Transport of essential goods was still allowed.

original: The first recorded incidents of COVID-19 infection in Bangladesh were on March 8, in two people who returned from Italy and also the wife of one of them.
simplification: The first recorded incidents of COVID-19 infection in Bangladesh were on March 8, in 2 people who returned from Italy and one of their wives.

original: As of March 19, these three had already recovered.
simplification: As of March 19, these 3 had recovered

original: SARS-CoV-2 surpasses one million infections worldwide
simplification: There have been over 1 million SARS-CoV-2 infections worldwide

original: On Thursday, the total number of cases of the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus infections surpassed one million worldwide, Johns Hopkins University data indicated.
simplification: On Thursday, the total number of cases of the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus infections surpassed one million worldwide, according to Johns Hopkins University data

original: Buyers were reportedly stocking up due to fears of COVID-19 in case people need to self-isolate.
simplification: Buyers were reportedly stocking up due to fears of self-isolation due to COVID-19.

original: On Wednesday, Woolworths also limited toilet paper purchases for home delivery to one pack per order.
simplification: On Wednesday, Woolworths also limited toilet paper purchases for home delivery to one pack per order.

original: These changes followed the previous four-pack per transaction restriction introduced by Woolworths and Coles on March 4 and 5 respectively.
simplification: previously, a four-pack per transaction restriction was introduced by Woolworths and Coles on March 4 and 5 respectively.

original: Coles, in its March 8 media release, reported that with the four-pack restriction in place, "many stores are still selling out within an hour of delivery", and called the demand "unprecedented", while ALDI, in a Facebook post on Tuesday, called it "unexpected".
simplification: Coles, in its March 8 media release, reported that with the four-pack restriction in place, "many stores are still selling out within an hour of delivery", and called the demand "unprecedented". ALDI, in a Facebook post on Tuesday, called it "unexpected".

original: Sales went up in a "sharp increase" last week, according to a Woolworths spokesperson.
simplification: Sales had a "sharp increase" last week, according to a Woolworths spokesperson.

original: Costco's store in Canberra also limited the allowed amount to two packs last week.
simplification: Costco's store in Canberra also limited the allowed amount to two packs.

original: To further alleviate the shortage, Coles ordered bigger packages from suppliers and increased delivery frequency, Woolworths ordered extra stock, while ALDI made stocks for a planned Wednesday special available early.
simplification: To alleviate the shortage, Coles ordered bigger packages from suppliers and increased delivery frequency. Woolworths ordered extra stock, while ALDI made stocks for a planned Wednesday special available early.

original: Russell Zimmerman, executive director of the Australian Retailers Association, said that retailers try to raise stock, but local council restrictions on the timing of truck-deliveries make it hard.
simplification: Russell Zimmerman, executive director of the Australian Retailers Association, said that retailers try to raise stock, but local council restrictions on the timing of truck-deliveries make it hard.

original: He expects rising production costs, as suppliers try to meet demand, and fewer specials.
simplification: He expects that, as suppliers try to meet demeand, there will be rising production costs and fewer special offers.

original: On Tuesday, ALDI announced that following the early release of stock, some stores can't run the Wednesday special.
simplification: Aldi announced on Tuesday that some stores cannot run the wednesday special, due to early release of stock.

original: In a News.com.au report, Dr Gary Mortimer, retail expert from Queensland University of Technology, said the stores fill the stock every night.
simplification: Dr Gary Mortimer, retail expert from Queensland University of Technology, said the stores fill the stock every night.

original: He remarked toilet paper is a bulky item, leading to low quantity of stocks in numbers, and, when sold out, leaves vast shelf spaces empty, hardening the feeling of a shortage.
simplification: He remarked toilet paper is a bulky item, leading to low quantity of stocks in numbers. When sold out,  it leaves vast shelf spaces empty, worsening the feeling of a shortage.

original: Coles and Woolworths have a view [that] if there was plenty of stuff on the shelf, if product like toilet rolls and sanitiser could be [bought] and are there in quantities, you would probably minimise the panic said Russell Zimmerman per ABC News.
simplification: "Coles and Woolworths have a view [that] if there was plenty of stuff on the shelf, if product like toilet rolls and sanitiser could be [bought] and are there in quantities, you would probably minimise the panic", said Russell Zimmerman for ABC News.

original: Recycled toilet paper producer Who Gives a Crap said on last Wednesday they'd run out of stock.
simplification: Recycled toilet paper producer, 'Who Gives a Crap', said they'd run out of stock on Wednesday

original: Kimberly-Clark, which makes Kleenex Toilet Tissue, and Solaris Paper which makes Sorbent, emphasized they were working 24/7 to maintain the supply, according to the News.com.au report.
simplification: Kimberly-Clark, which makes Kleenex Toilet Tissue, and Solaris Paper which makes Sorbent, emphasized they were working 24/7 to maintain the supply.

original: Domain.com, a real estate site, reported some property sellers offering free toilet paper to the first bidder on auctions in Melbourne, when fewer auctions were held because of buyers having time off on the long weekend of Labour Day.
simplification: Domain.com reported that some property sellers were offering free toilet paper to the first bidder on auctions in Melbourne, when fewer auctions were held because of buyers having time off for Labour Day.

original: The 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic is an ongoing pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
simplification: The 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic is an ongoing pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19). COVID-19 is caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

original: The 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic is an ongoing pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
simplification: The 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic is an ongoing pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19). COVID-19 is caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

original: The outbreak was identified in Wuhan, China, in December 2019, declared to be a Public Health Emergency of International Concern on 30 January 2020, and recognized as a pandemic on 11 March 2020.
simplification: The outbreak was identified in Wuhan, China, in December 2019. It was declared to be a Public Health Emergency of International Concern on 30 January 2020, and recognized as a pandemic on 11 March 2020.

original: The outbreak was identified in Wuhan, China, in December 2019, declared to be a Public Health Emergency of International Concern on 30 January 2020, and recognized as a pandemic on 11 March 2020.
simplification: The outbreak was identified in Wuhan, China, in December 2019. It was declared to be a Public Health Emergency of International Concern on 30 January 2020, and recognized as a pandemic on 11 March 2020.

original: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 1.61 million cases of COVID-19 have been reported in 210 countries and territories, resulting in approximately 97,000 deaths.
simplification: As of 10 April 2020, about 1.61 million cases of COVID-19 have been reported across the world, resulting in approximately 97,000 deaths.

original: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 1.61 million cases of COVID-19 have been reported in 210 countries and territories, resulting in approximately 97,000 deaths.
simplification: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 1.61 million cases of COVID-19 have been reported across the world, resulting in approximately 97,000 deaths.

original: About 364,000 people have recovered.
simplification: About 364,000 people have recovered.

original: About 364,000 people have recovered.
simplification: About 364,000 people have recovered.

original: The case fatality rate has been estimated to be 4% in China, while globally ranging from 13.04% in Algeria to .08% in New Zealand.
simplification: The death rate has been estimated to be 4% in China. Globally, this ranges from 13.04% in Algeria to .08% in New Zealand.

original: The case fatality rate has been estimated to be 4% in China, while globally ranging from 13.04% in Algeria to .08% in New Zealand.
simplification: The fatality rate has been estimated to be 4% in China. Globally, this ranges from 13.04% in Algeria to .08% in New Zealand.

original: Common symptoms include fever, cough and shortness of breath.
simplification: Common symptoms include a high temperature, cough, and difficulty breathing

original: Common symptoms include fever, cough and shortness of breath.
simplification: Common symptoms include fever, cough and difficulty breathing

original: Complications may include pneumonia and acute respiratory distress syndrome.
simplification: Complications can include pneumonia and acute respiratory distress syndrome

original: Complications may include pneumonia and acute respiratory distress syndrome.
simplification: Complications may include pneumonia and acute respiratory distress syndrome.

original: The time from exposure to onset of symptoms is typically around five days, but may range from two to fourteen days.
simplification: Onset of symptoms following exposure to COVID-19 is typically around 5 days, but may range from 2 to 14 days.

original: The time from exposure to onset of symptoms is typically around five days, but may range from two to fourteen days.
simplification: The time from exposure to onset of symptoms is typically around 5 days. However, this may range from 2 to 14 days

original: There is no known vaccine or specific antiviral treatment.
simplification: There is no known treatment or vaccine available

original: There is no known vaccine or specific antiviral treatment.
simplification: There is no known vaccine or specific treatment.

original: Primary treatment is symptomatic and supportive therapy.Recommended preventive measures include hand washing, covering one's mouth when coughing, maintaining distance from other people, and monitoring and self-isolation for people who suspect they are infected.
simplification: Treatment involved managing symptoms. The recommended preventative measures include hand washing, maintaining social distance, and self isolation for those infected.

original: Primary treatment is symptomatic and supportive therapy.Recommended preventive measures include hand washing, covering one's mouth when coughing, maintaining distance from other people, and monitoring and self-isolation for people who suspect they are infected.
simplification: Treatment involved managing symptoms. The recommended preventative measures include hand washing, maintaining social distance, and self isolation for those infected.

original: Authorities worldwide have responded by implementing travel restrictions, quarantines, curfews, workplace hazard controls, and facility closures.
simplification: Authorities around the world have responded by issuing several types of restrictions and closures.

original: Authorities worldwide have responded by implementing travel restrictions, quarantines, curfews, workplace hazard controls, and facility closures.
simplification: Authorities around the world have responded by issuing several types of restrictions and closures.

original: The pandemic has led to severe global socioeconomic disruption, the postponement or cancellation of sporting, religious, political and cultural events, and widespread shortages of supplies exacerbated by panic buying.
simplification: The pandemic has led to severe social and economic disruption, cancellations of events, and widespread shortages of supplies.

original: The pandemic has led to severe global socioeconomic disruption, the postponement or cancellation of sporting, religious, political and cultural events, and widespread shortages of supplies exacerbated by panic buying.
simplification: The pandemic has led to severe social and economic disruption, cancellations of events, and widespread shortages of supplies.

original: Schools and universities have closed either on a nationwide or local basis in 193 countries, affecting approximately 99.4 percent  of the world's student population.
simplification: Schools and universities have closed either on a nationwide or lacal basis in 193 countries. These closures hve affected approximately 99.4% of the world's student population

original: Schools and universities have closed either on a nationwide or local basis in 193 countries, affecting approximately 99.4 percent  of the world's student population.
simplification: Schools and universities have closed either on a nationwide or lacal basis in 193 countries. These closures hve affected approximately 99.4% of the world's student population

original: Misinformation about the virus has spread online, and there have been incidents of xenophobia and discrimination against Chinese people, other people of East and Southeast Asian descent and appearance, and others from areas with significant virus cases.
simplification: Misinformation about the virus has been spread online, causing incidents of xenophonia and discrimination against Chinese people, East and Southeast Asian people, and others from areas with high virus cases.

original: Misinformation about the virus has spread online, and there have been incidents of xenophobia and discrimination against Chinese people, other people of East and Southeast Asian descent and appearance, and others from areas with significant virus cases.
simplification: Misinformation about the virus has been spread online, causing incidents of xenophonia and discrimination against Chinese people, East and Southeast Asian people, and others from areas with high virus cases.

original: Due to reduced travel and closures of heavy industry, there has been a decrease in air pollution and carbon emissions.
simplification: There has been a decrease in pollution and carbon emissions due to reduced travel and industry closure.

original: Due to reduced travel and closures of heavy industry, there has been a decrease in air pollution and carbon emissions.
simplification: There has been a decrease in pollution and carbon emissions due to reduced travel and industry closure.

original: Health authorities in Wuhan, China (the capital of Hubei province) reported a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 31 December 2019, and an investigation was launched in early January 2020.
simplification: Health authorities in Wuhan, China reported a group of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on the 31st December 2019. An investigation was launched in early January 2020.

original: Health authorities in Wuhan, China (the capital of Hubei province) reported a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 31 December 2019, and an investigation was launched in early January 2020.
simplification: Health authorities in Wuhan, China reported a group of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on the 31st December 2019. An investigation was launched in early January 2020.

original: The cases mostly had links to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market and so the virus is thought to have a zoonotic origin.
simplification: Most of the cases had links to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, so it is thought that the virus originates from an animal.

original: The cases mostly had links to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market and so the virus is thought to have a zoonotic origin.
simplification: Most of the cases had links to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, so it is thought that the virus originates from an animal.

original: The virus that caused the outbreak is known as SARS-CoV-2, a newly discovered virus closely related to bat coronaviruses, pangolin coronaviruses, and SARS-CoV.The earliest known person with symptoms was later discovered to have fallen ill on 1 December 2019, and that person did not have visible connections with the later wet market cluster.
simplification: The virus that caused the outbreak is known as SARS-CoV-2 is a newly discovered virus closely related to bat coronaviruses, pangolin coronaviruses, and SARS-CoV. The first person with symptoms was later discovered to have fallen ill on 1 December 2019, and that person did not have visible connections with the later wet market cluster.

original: On 13 March 2020, an unverified report from the South China Morning Post suggested that a case traced back to 17 November 2019, in a 55-year-old from Hubei province, may have been the first.On 26 February 2020, the WHO reported that, as new cases reportedly declined in China but suddenly increased in Italy, Iran, and South Korea, the number of new cases outside China had exceeded the number of new cases within China for the first time.
simplification: On 13 March 2020, an unverified report from the South China Morning Post suggested that a case traced back to 17 November 2019, in a 55-year-old from Hubei province, may have been the first. On 26 February 2020, the WHO reported that, as new cases reportedly declined in China but suddenly increased in Italy, Iran, and South Korea, the number of new cases outside China had exceeded the number of new cases within China for the first time.

original: There may be substantial underreporting of cases, particularly among those with milder symptoms.
simplification: There may be underreporting of cases, particularly among those with milder symptoms.

original: By 26 February, relatively few cases had been reported among youths, with those 19 and under making up 2.4% of cases worldwide.The United Kingdom's chief scientific adviser, Patrick Vallance, estimated that 60% of the British population would need to become infected before effective herd immunity could be achieved.
simplification: By 26 February, relatively few cases had been reported among youths; those 19 and under only making up 2.4% of cases worldwide.The United Kingdom's chief scientific adviser, Patrick Vallance, estimated that 60% of the British population would need to become infected before effective herd immunity could be achieved.

original: Cases refers to the number of people who have been tested for COVID-19, and whose test has been confirmed positive according to official protocols.
simplification: Cases refers to the number of people who have had a positive result following a COVID-19 test, according to official protocols.

original: As of 23 March, no country had tested more than 3% of its population, and many countries have had official policies not to test those with only mild symptoms, such as Italy, the Netherlands, Spain, and Switzerland.
simplification: As of 23 March, no country had tested more than 3% of its population. Many countries have had official policies not to test those with only mild symptoms, such as Italy, the Netherlands, Spain, and Switzerland.

original: A study published on 16 March found that in China, up to 23 January, an estimated 86% of COVID-19 infections had not been detected, and that these undocumented infections were the infection source for 79% of documented cases.
simplification: A study found that in China, up to the 23rd January, an estimated 86% of COVID-19 infections had not been detected. Also, these undocumented infections were the infection source for 79% of documented cases.

original: A statistical analysis published 30 March estimated that numbers of infections in Italy were considerably greater than the reported cases.
simplification: A statistical analysis published 30 March estimated that numbers of infections in Italy were significantly greater than the numbers of reported cases.

original: The initial estimates of the basic reproduction number (R0) for COVID-19 were 1.4 to 2.4.
simplification: The first estimates of the basic reproduction number (R0) for COVID-19 were 1.4 to 2.4.

original: A study published by the US Center for Disease Control and Prevention has concluded that it may be 5.7.
simplification: A study published by the US Center for Disease Control and Prevention has decided that it may be 5.7.

original: Most people with COVID-19 recover.
simplification: Most people with COVID-19 recover.

original: For those who do not, the time from development of symptoms to death has been between 6 and 41 days, with the most common being 14 days.
simplification: For those who do not recover, the time from development of symptoms to death has been between 6 and 41 days. The most common time is 14 days.

original: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 97,000 deaths had been attributed to COVID-19.
simplification: As of 10 April 2020, about 97,000 deaths had been attributed to COVID-19.

original: In China, as of 5 February about 80% of deaths were in those over 60, and 75% had pre-existing health conditions including cardiovascular diseases and diabetes.Official tallies of deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic generally refer to dead people who tested positive for COVID according to official protocols.
simplification: In China, as of 5 February about 80% of deaths were in those over 60, and 75% had pre-existing health conditions. Official tallies of deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic generally refer to people who died following a positive test for COVID, according to official protocols.

original: The number of true fatalities from COVID-19 may be much higher, as it may not include people who die without testing - e.g. at home, in nursing homes, etc.
simplification: The number of true fatalities from COVID-19 may be much higher, as it may not include people who die at home or in nursing homes without testing.

original: Partial data from Italy found that the number of excess deaths during the pandemic exceeded the official COVID death tally by a factor of 4-5x.
simplification: Partial data from Italy found that the number of excess deaths during the pandemic exceeded the official COVID death tally by 4-5x

original: A spokeswoman for the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) acknowledged "We know that [the stated death toll] is an underestimation", a statement corroborated by anecdotal reports of undercounting in the U.S. Such underestimation often occurs in pandemics, such as the 2009 H1N1 swine flu epidemic.The first confirmed death was in Wuhan on 9 January 2020.
simplification: A representative from the Centre of Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said that the number of deaths caused by COVID were underestimated in the US. However, it can happen in an global outbreak like the H1N1 swine flu. The first COVID-19 Death was recorded in Wuhan on 9 January 2020.

original: The first death outside mainland China occurred on 1 February in the Philippines, and the first death outside Asia was in France on 14 February.
simplification: The first death outside mainland China occurred on 1 February in the Philippines. The first death outside Asia was in France on 14 February.

original: By 28 February, outside mainland China, more than a dozen deaths each were recorded in Iran, South Korea, and Italy.
simplification: By 28 February, more than a dozen deaths each were recorded in Iran, South Korea, and Italy.

original: By 13 March, more than forty countries and territories had reported deaths, on every continent except Antarctica.Several measures are commonly used to quantify mortality.
simplification: By 13 March, more than forty countries had reported deaths, on every continent except Antarctica. Several measures are commonly used to quantify death rate.

original: These numbers vary by region and over time, and are influenced by the volume of testing, healthcare system quality, treatment options, time since initial outbreak, and population characteristics such as age, sex, and overall health.The death-to-case ratio reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of diagnosed cases within a given time interval.
simplification: These numbers vary by region and over time. They are also influenced by the volume of testing, healthcare system quality, treatment options and time since initial outbreak. Population characteristics such as age, sex, and overall health affect these numbers.The death-to-case ratio reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of diagnosed cases within a given time.

original: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the global death-to-case ratio is 6.0% (97,039/1,617,204) as of 10 April 2020.
simplification: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the global death-to-case ratio is 6.0% as of 10 April 2020

original: It is thought to have a zoonotic origin.
simplification: It is thought to have come from an animal.

original: It is 96% identical at the whole genome level to other bat coronavirus samples (BatCov RaTG13).
simplification: It is 96% identical to other bat coronavirus samples (BatCov RaTG13).

original: In February 2020, Chinese researchers found that there is only one amino acid difference in certain parts of the genome sequences between the viruses from pangolins and those from humans.
simplification: Chinese researchers found that there is only one amino acid difference in certain parts of the genome sequences between the viruses from pangolins and those from humans.

original: Whole-genome comparison to date has found at most 92% of genetic material shared between pangolin coronavirus and SARS-CoV-2, which is insufficient to prove pangolins to be the intermediate host.
simplification: Whole-genome comparison to date has found that up to 92% of genetic material is shared between pangolin coronavirus and SARS-CoV-2. This is insufficient to prove pangolins to be the intermediate host.

original: Infection by the virus can be provisionally diagnosed on the basis of symptoms, though confirmation is ultimately by reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) of infected secretions or CT imaging.
simplification: Infection by the virus can be provisionally diagnosed on the basis of symptoms. However, infection is ultimately confirmed by reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) of infected secretions or CT imaging.

original: A study comparing PCR to CT in Wuhan has suggested that CT is significantly more sensitive than PCR, though less specific, with many of its imaging features overlapping with other pneumonias and disease processes.
simplification: A study comparing PCR to CT has suggested that CT is significantly more sensitive than PCR, with many of its imaging features overlapping with other pneumonias and disease processes.

original: As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommends that "CT should not be used to screen for or as a first-line test to diagnose COVID-19".
simplification: As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommends that "CT should not be used to screen for or as a first test to diagnose COVID-19".

original: The WHO has published several RNA testing protocols for SARS-CoV-2, with the first issued on 17 January.
simplification: The WHO has published several RNA testing protocols for SARS-CoV-2. The first RNA testing protocols issued were on 17 January.

original: The test uses real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).
simplification: The test uses real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).

original: The test can be done on respiratory or blood samples.
simplification: The test can be done on respiratory or blood samples.

original: Results are generally available within a few hours to days.
simplification: Results are generally available within a few hours, or up to a few days.

original: Generally this test is carried out on a nasopharyngeal swab though a throat swab may also be used.A number of laboratories and companies are developing serological tests, which detect antibodies.
simplification: This test is generally carried out on a nasopharyngeal swab, though a throat swab may also be used. A number of laboratories are developing serological tests, which detect antibodies.

original: As of 6 April 2020, none of these has been proved sufficiently accurate to be approved for widespread use.
simplification: As of 6 April 2020, none of these has been proved accurate enough to be approved for widespread use.

original: In the US a serological test developed by Cellex has been approved for emergency use by certified laboratories only.
simplification: In the US, a serological test developed by Cellex has been approved for emergency use by certified laboratories only.

original: Characteristic imaging features on radiographs and computed tomography (CT) of people who are symptomatic include asymmetric peripheral ground glass opacities and absent pleural effusions.
simplification: Characteristic imaging features on radiographs and computed tomography (CT) of people who are symptomatic include asymmetric peripheral ground glass opacities and lack of pleural effusions.

original: The Italian Radiological Society is compiling an international online database of imaging findings for confirmed cases.
simplification: The Italian Radiological Society is putting together an international online database of imaging findings for confirmed cases.

original: Due to overlap with other infections such as adenovirus, imaging without confirmation by PCR is of limited specificity in identifying COVID-19.
simplification: Imaging without confirmation by PCR is of limited specificity in identifying COVID-19 due to overlap with other infections.

original: A large study in China compared chest CT results to PCR and demonstrated that though imaging is less specific for the infection, it is faster and more sensitive, suggesting its consideration as a screening tool in epidemic areas.
simplification: A large study in China compared chest CT results to PCR and demonstrated that though imaging is less specific for the infection, it is faster and more sensitive. This suggests its consideration as a screening tool in epidemic areas.

original: Artificial intelligence-based convolutional neural networks have been developed to detect imaging features of the virus with both radiographs and CT.
simplification: Artificial intelligence-based convolutional neural networks have been developed to detect imaging features of the virus with both radiographs and CT.

original: Strategies for preventing transmission of the disease include maintaining overall good personal hygiene, washing hands, avoiding touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands, and coughing or sneezing into a tissue and putting the tissue directly into a waste container.
simplification: Strategies for preventing transmission of the disease include maintaining overall good personal hygiene.

original: Those who may already have the infection have been advised to wear a surgical mask in public.
simplification: Those who may already have the infection have been told to wear a surgical mask in public.

original: Physical distancing measures are also recommended to prevent transmission.Many governments have restricted or advised against all non-essential travel to and from countries and areas affected by the outbreak.
simplification: Physical distancing measures are also recommended to prevent transmission. Many governments have restricted or advised against all non-essential travel to and from areas affected by the outbreak.

original: However, the virus has reached the stage of community spread in large parts of the world.
simplification: However, the virus has spread in communities in large parts of the world.

original: This means that the virus is spreading within communities, and some community members don't know where or how they were infected.Health care providers taking care of someone who may be infected are recommended to use standard precautions, contact precautions, and eye protection.Contact tracing is an important method for health authorities to determine the source of an infection and to prevent further transmission.
simplification: This means that the virus is spreading within communities, and some individuals don't know where or how they were infected. Health care providers taking care of someone who may be infected are recommended to use standard precautions, contact precautions, and eye protection. Contact tracing is an important method for health authorities to determine the source of an infection and to prevent further transmission.

original: The use of location data from mobile phones by governments for this purpose has prompted privacy concerns, with Amnesty International and over 100 other organizations issuing a statement calling for limits on this kind of surveillance.
simplification: The use of location data from mobile phones by governments for this purpose has prompted privacy concerns. Amnesty International and over 100 other organizations have issued a statement calling for limits on this kind of surveillance.

original: Various mobile apps have been implemented or proposed for voluntary use, and as of April 7, 2020, over a dozen expert groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.
simplification: Various mobile apps have been implemented or proposed for voluntary use and over a dozen expert groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.

original: Users then receive a message if they've been in close contact with someone who has tested positive for COVID-19.Misconceptions are circulating about how to prevent infection; for example, rinsing the nose and gargling with mouthwash are not effective.
simplification: Users then receive a message if they've been in close contact with someone who has tested positive for COVID-19. Misconceptions are circulating about how to prevent infection; such as rinsing the nose and gargling with mouthwash. These methods are not effective in preventing infection.

original: There is no COVID-19 vaccine, though many organizations are working to develop one.
simplification: There is no COVID-19 vaccine, though many organizations are working to develop one.

original: Hand washing is recommended to prevent the spread of the disease.
simplification: Hand washing is recommended to prevent the spread of the disease.

original: The CDC recommends that people wash hands often with soap and water for at least twenty seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty; before eating; and after blowing one's nose, coughing, or sneezing.
simplification: The CDC recommends that people wash hands often with soap and water for at least twenty seconds.

original: This is because outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which bursts its protective bubble.
simplification: This is because outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap.

original: CDC further recommended using an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol by volume when soap and water are not readily available.
simplification: CDC further recommended using an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol when soap and water are not available.

original: The WHO advises people to avoid touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands.
simplification: The WHO advises people to avoid touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands.

original: Surfaces may be decontaminated with a number of solutions (within one minute of exposure to the disinfectant for a stainless steel surface), including 62–71% ethanol, 50–100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, and 0.2–7.5% povidone-iodine.
simplification: Surfaces may be decontaminated with a number of solutions, including 62–71% ethanol, 50–100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, and 0.2–7.5% povidone-iodine.

original: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chrohexidine gluconate, are less effective.
simplification: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chrohexidine gluconate, are less effective.

original: The CDC recommends that if a COVID case is suspected or confirmed at a facility such as an office or day care, all areas such as offices, bathrooms, common areas, shared electronic equipment like tablets, touch screens, keyboards, remote controls, and ATM machines used by the ill persons, should be disinfected.
simplification: The CDC recommends that if a COVID case is suspected or confirmed at a facility such as an office or day care, all areas and equipment used by the ill persons, should be disinfected.

original: Health organizations recommended that people cover their mouth and nose with a bent elbow or a tissue when coughing or sneezing, and disposing of any tissue immediately.
simplification: Health organizations recommended that people cover their mouth and nose with a bent elbow or a tissue when coughing or sneezing, and disposing of any tissue immediately.

original: Surgical masks are recommended for those who may be infected, as wearing a mask can limit the volume and travel distance of expiratory droplets dispersed when talking, sneezing, and coughing.
simplification: Surgical masks are recommended for those who may be infected. Wearing a mask can limit the volume and travel distance of expiratory droplets dispersed when talking, sneezing, and coughing.

original: The WHO has issued instructions on when and how to use masks.
simplification: The WHO has issued instructions on when and how to use masks.

original: According to Stephen Griffin, a virologist at the University of Leeds, "Wearing a mask can reduce the propensity [of] people to touch their faces, which is a major source of infection without proper hand hygiene."Masks have also been recommended for use by those taking care of someone who may have the disease.
simplification: According to Stephen Griffin, a virologist at the University of Leeds, "Wearing a mask can reduce the tendency of people to touch their faces, which is a major source of infection without proper hand hygiene." Masks have also been recommended for use by those taking care of someone who may have the disease.

original: The WHO has recommended the wearing of masks by healthy people only if they are at high risk, such as those who are caring for a person with COVID-19, although they also acknowledge that wearing masks may help people avoid touching their face.
simplification: The WHO has recommended the wearing of masks by healthy people only if they are at high risk, such as those who are caring for a person with COVID-19. However, they also acknowledge that wearing masks may help people avoid touching their face.Several countries have started to encourage the use of face masks by members of the public.

original: Several countries have started to encourage the use of face masks by members of the public.
simplification: Several countries have started to encourage the use of face masks by members of the public.

original: In the U.S., the CDC recommends wearing non-medical face mask made out of cloth.China has specifically recommended the use of disposable medical masks by healthy members of the public, particularly when coming into close contact (1 metre (3 ft) or less) with other people.
simplification: In the U.S., the CDC recommends wearing non-medical face mask made out of cloth. China has specifically recommended the use of disposable medical masks by healthy members of the public, particularly when coming into close contact with other people.

original: Hong Kong recommends wearing a surgical mask when taking public transport or staying in crowded places.
simplification: Hong Kong recommends wearing a surgical mask when taking public transport or staying in crowded places.

original: Thailand's health officials are encouraging people to make cloth facemasks at home and wash them daily.
simplification: Thailand's health officials are encouraging people to make cloth facemasks at home and wash them daily.

original: The Czech Republic and Slovakia banned going out in public without wearing a mask or covering one's nose and mouth.
simplification: The Czech Republic and Slovakia banned going out in public without wearing a mask or covering the nose and mouth.

original: On 16 March, Vietnam requested everyone to wear a face mask when going to public areas in order to protect themselves and others.
simplification: On 16 March, Vietnam requested everyone to wear a face mask when going to public areas. This request was made in order to protect everyone.

original: The Austrian government mandated that everyone entering a grocery store must wear a face mask.
simplification: The Austrian government made a law that everyone entering a grocery store must wear a face mask.

original: Israel has asked all residents to wear face masks when in public.
simplification: Israel has asked everyone to wear face masks when in public.

original: Taiwan, which has been producing ten million masks per day since mid-March, required passengers on trains and intercity buses to wear face masks on 1 April.
simplification: Taiwan required passengers on trains and intercity buses to wear face masks on 1 April.

original: Panama has made it obligatory to wear a face mask whenever going outside, while also recommending the manufacture of a homemade face mask for those who cannot purchase face masks.
simplification: Panama has made it obligatory to wear a face mask whenever going outside. They also recommend the manufacture of a homemade face mask for those who cannot purchase face masks.

original: Face masks have also been widely used in Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, and Singapore.
simplification: Face masks have also been widely used in Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, and Singapore.

original: Social distancing (also known as physical distancing) includes infection control actions intended to slow the spread of disease by minimizing close contact between individuals.
simplification: Social distancing includes infection control actions intended to slow the spread of disease by reducing close contact between individuals.

original: Methods include quarantines; travel restrictions; and the closing of schools, workplaces, stadiums, theatres, or shopping centres.
simplification: Methods include quarantines; travel restrictions; and the closing of schools, workplaces, and recreational establishments.

original: Individuals may apply social distancing methods by staying at home, limiting travel, avoiding crowded areas, using no-contact greetings, and physically distancing themselves from others.
simplification: There are many ways that Individuals may apply social distancing methods. These include staying at home, limiting travel, avoiding crowded areas, using no-contact greetings, and physically distancing themselves from others.

original: Many governments are now mandating or recommending social distancing in regions affected by the outbreak.
simplification: Many governments are now mandating or recommending social distancing in regions affected by the outbreak.

original: The maximum gathering size recommended by US government bodies and health organizations was swiftly reduced from 250 people (if there was no known COVID-19 spread in a region) to 50 people, and later to 10 people.
simplification: The maximum gathering size recommended by US government bodies and health organizations was reduced from 250 people (if there was no known COVID-19 spread in a region) to 50 people, and later to 10 people.

original: On 22 March 2020, Germany banned public gatherings of more than two people.Older adults and those with underlying medical conditions such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, hypertension, and compromised immune systems face increased risk of serious illness and complications and have been advised by the CDC to stay home as much as possible in areas of community outbreak.In late March 2020, the WHO and other health bodies began to replace the use of the term "social distancing" with "physical distancing", to clarify that the aim is to reduce physical contact while maintaining social connections, either virtually or at a distance.
simplification: On 22 March 2020, Germany banned public gatherings of more than two people. Older adults and those with underlying medical conditions face increased risk of serious illness and complications and have been advised by the CDC to stay home as much as possible in areas of outbreak. In late March 2020, the WHO and other health bodies began to replace the use of the term "social distancing" with "physical distancing", to clarify that the aim is to reduce physical contact while maintaining social connections, either virtually or at a distance.

original: The use of the term "social distancing" had led to implications that people should engage in complete social isolation, rather than encouraging them to stay in contact with others through alternative means.Some authorities have issued sexual health guidelines for use during the pandemic.
simplification: The use of the term "social distancing" had led to implications that people should engage in complete social isolation, rather than encouraging them to stay in contact with others in different ways. Some authorities have issued sexual health guidelines for use during the pandemic.

original: These include recommendations to only have sex with someone you live with, who does not have the virus or symptoms of the virus.
simplification: These include recommendations to only have sex with someone you live with, who does not have the virus or symptoms of the virus.

original: Self-isolation at home has been recommended for those diagnosed with COVID-19 and those who suspect they have been infected.
simplification: Self-isolation at home has been recommended for those diagnosed with COVID-19 and those who suspect they have been infected.

original: Health agencies have issued detailed instructions for proper self-isolation.Many governments have mandated or recommended self-quarantine for entire populations living in affected areas.
simplification: Health agencies have released detailed instructions for proper self-isolation. Many governments have mandated or recommended self-quarantine for entire populations living in affected areas.

original: The strongest self-quarantine instructions have been issued to those in high risk groups.
simplification: The strongest self-quarantine instructions have been issued to those in high risk groups.

original: Those who may have been exposed to someone with COVID-19 and those who have recently travelled to a country or region with widespread transmission have been advised to self-quarantine for 14 days from the time of last possible exposure.
simplification: Those who may have been exposed to someone with COVID-19, and those who have recently travelled to a country or region with widespread transmission, have been advised to self-quarantine for 14 days. The 14 day self-isolation starts from the time of last possible exposure.

original: Strategies in the control of an outbreak are containment or suppression, and mitigation.
simplification: Strategies to control an outbreak are containment or suppression, and mitigation.

original: All South Korean military bases were quarantined after tests confirmed that three soldiers were positive for the virus.
simplification: All South Korean military bases were quarantined after tests confirmed that 3 soldiers were positive for the virus.

original: Airline schedules were also affected and therefore they were changed.South Korea introduced what was considered the largest and best-organized programme in the world to screen the population for the virus, and isolate any infected people as well as tracing and quarantining those who contacted them.
simplification: Airline schedules were also affected, so they were changed. South Korea introduced what was considered the largest and best-organized programme in the world to screen the population for the virus, and isolate any infected people. The programme also involved tracing and quarantining those who were in contact with an infected person.

original: Screening methods included mandatory self-reporting of symptoms by new international arrivals through mobile application, drive-thru testing for the virus with the results available the next day, and increasing testing capability to allow up to 20,000 people to be tested every day.
simplification: Screening methods included mandatory self-reporting of symptoms by new international arrivals through mobile application, drive-thru testing for the virus with next day results, and increasing testing capability to allow up to 20,000 people to be tested every day.

original: South Korea's programme is considered to be a success in controlling the outbreak despite not quarantining entire cities.The South Korean society was initially polarized on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.
simplification: South Korea's programme is considered to be a success in controlling the outbreak, despite not quarantining entire cities. The South Korean society was initially divided on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.

original: Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.
simplification: Many Koreans signed petitions calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, whilst some were signing petitions praising his response.

original: On 23 March, it was reported that South Korea had the lowest one-day case total in four weeks.
simplification: On 23 March, it was reported that South Korea had the lowest one-day case total in 4 weeks.

original: On 29 March it was reported that beginning 1 April all new overseas arrivals will be quarantined for two weeks.
simplification: On 29 March, it was reported that all new overseas arrivals will be quarantined for two weeks, beginning 1 April.

original: Per media reports on 1 April, South Korea has received requests for virus testing assistance from 121 different countries.
simplification: According to media reports on 1 April, South Korea has received requests for virus testing assistance from 121 different countries.

original: Iran reported its first confirmed cases of SARS-CoV-2 infections on 19 February in Qom, where, according to the Ministry of Health and Medical Education, two people died later that day.
simplification: Iran reported its first confirmed cases of SARS-CoV-2 infections on 19 February in Qom, where it was reported that two people died later that day.

original: Early measures announced by the government included the cancellation of concerts and other cultural events, sporting events, and Friday prayers, and closures of universities, higher education institutions, and schools.
simplification: Early measures announced by the government included the cancellation of concerts and other cultural events, sporting events, and Friday prayers. Closures of universities, higher education institutions, and schools were also announced.

original: Iran allocated five trillion rials to combat the virus.
simplification: Iran allocated five trillion rials to combat the virus.

original: President Hassan Rouhani said on 26 February 2020 that there were no plans to quarantine areas affected by the outbreak, and only individuals would be quarantined.
simplification: President Hassan Rouhani said on 26 February 2020 that there were no plans to quarantine areas affected by the outbreak, and only individuals would be quarantined.

original: Plans to limit travel between cities were announced in March, although heavy traffic between cities ahead of the Persian New Year Nowruz continued.
simplification: Plans to limit travel between cities were announced in March. However, heavy traffic between cities ahead of the Persian New Year Nowruz continued.

original: Shia shrines in Qom remained open to pilgrims until 16 March 2020.Iran became a centre of the spread of the virus after China during February.
simplification: Shia shrines in Qom remained open to pilgrims until 16 March 2020. Iran became a centre of the spread of the virus during February.

original: Amidst claims of a cover-up of the extent of the outbreak in Iran, more than ten countries had traced their cases back to Iran by 28 February, indicating that the extent of the outbreak may be more severe than the 388 cases reported by the Iranian government by that date.
simplification: Amidst claims of a cover-up of the extent of the outbreak in Iran, more than ten countries had traced their cases back to Iran by 28 February. This suggested that the extent of the outbreak may be more severe than the 388 cases reported by the Iranian government by that date.

original: The Iranian Parliament was shut down, with 23 of its 290 members reported to have had tested positive for the virus on 3 March.
simplification: The Iranian Parliament was shut down, with 23 of its 290 members reported to have had tested positive for the virus on 3rd March.

original: On 12 March, the Human Rights Watch urged the Iranian prison authorities to unconditionally release the human rights defenders detained for peaceful dissent, and to also temporarily release all the eligible prisoners.
simplification: On 12 March, the Human Rights Watch urged the Iranian prison authorities to unconditionally release the human rights defenders detained for peaceful dissent. They also asked for the temporary release all the eligible prisoners.

original: It stated that there is a greater risk of the virus to spread in closed institutions like detention centres, which also lack adequate medical care.
simplification: It is thought that there is a greater risk of the virus to spread in closed institutions, like detention centres, which also lack adequate medical care.

original: On 15 March, the Iranian government reported 100 deaths in a single day, the most recorded in the country since the outbreak began.
simplification: On 15 March, the Iranian government reported 100 deaths in a single day. This was the most recorded in the country since the outbreak began.

original: At least 12 sitting or former Iranian politicians and government officials had died from the disease by 17 March.
simplification: At least 12 sitting or former Iranian politicians and government officials had died from the disease by 17 March.

original: By 23 March, Iran was experiencing 50 new cases every hour and one new death every ten minutes due to coronavirus.
simplification: By 23 March, Iran was experiencing 50 new cases every hour and one new death every 10 minutes due to coronavirus.

original: According to a WHO official, there may be five times more cases in Iran than what is being reported.
simplification: According to a WHO official, there may be five times more cases in Iran than what is being reported.

original: It is also suggested that U.S. sanctions on Iran may be affecting the country's financial ability to respond to the viral outbreak.
simplification: It is also suggested that U.S. sanctions on Iran may be affecting the country's financial ability to respond to the virus outbreak.

original: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights has demanded economic sanctions to be eased for nations most affected by the pandemic, including Iran.
simplification: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights has demanded economic sanctions to be eased for nations most affected by the pandemic, including Iran.

original: The outbreak was confirmed to have spread to Italy on 31 January, when two Chinese tourists tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.
simplification: The outbreak was confirmed to have spread to Italy on 31 January, when two Chinese tourists tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.

original: Cases began to rise sharply, which prompted the Italian government to suspend all flights to and from China and declare a state of emergency.
simplification: Cases began to rise sharply, which prompted the Italian government to suspend all flights to and from China. The Italian government also declared a state of emergency.

original: An unassociated cluster of COVID-19 cases was later detected, starting with 16 confirmed cases in Lombardy on 21 February.On 22 February, the Council of Ministers announced a new decree-law to contain the outbreak, including quarantining more than 50,000 people from 11 different municipalities in northern Italy.
simplification: An unassociated cluster of COVID-19 cases was later detected. This started with 16 confirmed cases in Lombardy on 21 February. On 22 February, the Council of Ministers announced a new decree-law to contain the outbreak. The decree-law included quarantining more than 50,000 people from 11 different municipalities in northern Italy.

original: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, "In the outbreak areas, entry and exit will not be provided.
simplification: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, "In the outbreak areas, entry and exit will not be provided.

original: Suspension of work activities and sports events has already been ordered in those areas."On 4 March, the Italian government ordered the full closure of all schools and universities nationwide as Italy reached 100 deaths.
simplification: Suspension of work activities and sports events has already been ordered in those areas. On 4 March, as Italy reached 100 deaths, the Italian government ordered the full closure of all schools and universities nationwide.

original: All major sporting events, including Serie A football matches, were to be held behind closed doors until April, but on 9 March, all sport was suspended completely for at least one month.
simplification: All major sporting events, including Serie A football matches, were to be held behind closed doors until April. However, on 9 March, all sport was suspended completely for at least one month.

original: On 11 March, Prime Minister Conte ordered stoppage of nearly all commercial activity except supermarkets and pharmacies.On 6 March, the Italian College of Anaesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation and Intensive Care (SIAARTI) published medical ethics recommendations regarding triage protocols that might be employed.
simplification: On 11 March, Prime Minister Conte ordered stoppage of nearly all commercial activity, except supermarkets and pharmacies.
