simplification: The purpose of hand-washing in the health-care setting is to remove pathogenic microorganisms ("germs") and avoid passing them on.

original: The New England Journal of Medicine reports that a lack of hand-washing remains at unacceptable levels in most medical environments, with large numbers of doctors and nurses routinely forgetting to wash their hands before touching patients, thus transmitting microorganisms.
simplification: The New England Journal of Medicine reports that a lack of hand-washing remains at unacceptable levels in most medical environments. Large numbers of doctors and nurses routinely forgetting to wash their hands before touching patients, thus transmitting microorganisms.

original: One study showed that proper hand-washing and other simple procedures can decrease the rate of catheter-related bloodstream infections by 66 percent.The World Health Organization has published a sheet demonstrating standard hand-washing and hand-rubbing in health-care sectors.
simplification: One study showed that proper hand-washing can decrease the rate of catheter-related bloodstream infections by 66%.The World Health Organization has published a sheet demonstrating standard hand-washing and hand-rubbing in health-care sectors.

original: The draft guidance of hand hygiene by the organization can also be found at its website for public comment.
simplification: The draft guidance of hand hygiene by the organization can also be found at its website.

original: A relevant review was conducted by Whitby et al.
simplification: A suitable review was conducted by Whitby et al.

original: The World Health Organization has "Five Moments" for washing hands:
simplification: The World Health Organization has "Five Moments" for washing hands:

original: after exposure to blood/body fluids
simplification: after contact with blood/body fluids

original: before an aseptic task, and
simplification: before an aseptic task

original: after patient care.The addition of antiseptic chemicals to soap ("medicated" or "antimicrobial" soaps) confers killing action to a hand-washing agent.
simplification: After patient care. The addition of antiseptic chemicals to soap ("medicated" or "antimicrobial" soaps) gives killing action to a hand-washing agent.

original: Such killing action may be desired prior to performing surgery or in settings in which antibiotic-resistant organisms are highly prevalent.To 'scrub' one's hands for a surgical operation, it is necessary to have a tap that can be turned on and off without touching it with the hands, some chlorhexidine or iodine wash, sterile towels for drying the hands after washing, and a sterile brush for scrubbing and another sterile instrument for cleaning under the fingernails.
simplification: Such killing action may be desired prior to performing surgery or in settings in which antibiotic-resistant organisms are present.To 'scrub' one's hands for a surgical operation, it is necessary to have a tap that can be turned on and off without touching it with the hands, some chlorhexidine or iodine wash, sterile towels for drying the hands after washing, and a sterile brush for scrubbing and another sterile instrument for cleaning under the fingernails.

original: All jewelry should be removed.
simplification: Jewelry should be removed.

original: This procedure requires washing the hands and forearms up to the elbow, usually 2–6 minutes.
simplification: This procedure involves washing the hands and forearms up to the elbow, usually 2–6 minutes.

original: Long scrub-times (10 minutes) are not necessary.
simplification: Long scrub-times (10 minutes) are unecessary.

original: When rinsing, water on the forearms must be prevented from running back to the hands.
simplification: When rinsing, water on the forearms must be stopped from running back to the hands.

original: After hand-washing is completed, the hands are dried with a sterile cloth and a surgical gown is donned.
simplification: After hand-washing is completed, the hands are dried with a sterile cloth and a surgical gown is donned.

original: To reduce the spread of germs, it is better to wash the hands or use a hand antiseptic before and after tending to a sick person.
simplification: It is better to wash the hands or use a hand antiseptic before and after tending to a sick person to prevent the spread of germs.

original: For control of staphylococcal infections in hospitals, it has been found that the greatest benefit from hand-cleansing came from the first 20% of washing, and that very little additional benefit was gained when hand cleansing frequency was increased beyond 35%.
simplification: For control of staphylococcal infections in hospitals, it has been found that the greatest benefit from hand-cleansing came from the first 20% of washing. Very little additional benefit was gained when hand cleansing frequency was increased beyond 35%.

original: Washing with plain soap results in more than triple the rate of bacterial infectious disease transmitted to food as compared to washing with antibacterial soap.Comparing hand-rubbing with alcohol-based solution with hand washing with antibacterial soap for a median time of 30 seconds each showed that the alcohol hand-rubbing reduced bacterial contamination 26% more than the antibacterial soap.
simplification: Washing with plain soap results in more than 3x the rate of bacterial infectious disease transmitted to food compared to washing with antibacterial soap. Comparing alcohol-based solution with hand washing with antibacterial soap for an average time of 30 seconds each showed that the alcohol hand-rubbing reduced bacterial contamination 26% more than the antibacterial soap.

original: But soap and water is more effective than alcohol-based hand rubs for reducing H1N1 influenza A virus and Clostridium difficile spores from hands.Interventions to improve hand hygiene in healthcare settings can involve education for staff on hand washing, increasing the availability of alcohol-based hand rub, and written and verbal reminders to staff.
simplification: Soap and water is more effective than alcohol-based hand rubs for reducing H1N1 influenza A virus and Clostridium difficile from hands. Interventions to improve hand hygiene in healthcare settings can involve education for staff on hand washing, increasing the availability of alcohol-based hand rub, and written and verbal reminders to staff.

original: There is a need for more research into which of these interventions are most effective in different healthcare settings.
simplification: There needs to be more research into which of these interventions are most effective in different healthcare settings.

original: In developing countries, hand washing with soap is recognized as a cost-effective, essential tool for achieving good health, and even good nutrition.
simplification: In developing countries, hand washing with soap is recognized as a cost-effective, essential tool for achieving good health, and even good nutrition.

original: However, a lack of reliable water supply, soap or hand washing facilities in people's homes, at schools and at the workplace make it a challenge to achieve universal hand washing behaviors.
simplification: However, a lack of reliable water supply, soap or hand washing facilities in people's homes, at schools and at the workplace make it a challenge to achieve universal hand washing behaviors.

original: For example, in most of rural Africa hand washing taps close to every private or public toilet are scarce, even though cheap options exist to build hand washing stations.
simplification: In most of rural Africa, hand washing taps close to every private or public toilet are scarce.

original: However, low hand washing rates rather can also be the result of engrained habits rather than due to a lack of soap or water.
simplification: Low hand washing rates can also be the result of engrained habits, rather than due to a lack of soap or water.

original: The promotion and advocacy of hand washing with soap can influence policy decisions, raise awareness about the benefits of hand washing and lead to long-term behavior change of the population.
simplification: The promotion of hand washing with soap can influence policy decisions, raise awareness about the benefits of hand washing and lead to long-term behavior change of the population.

original: For this to work effectively, monitoring and evaluation are necessary.
simplification: Monitoring and evaluation are necessary for this to work effectively.

original: A systematic review of 70 studies found that community-based approaches are effective at increasing hand washing in LMICs, while social marketing campaigns are less effective.One example for hand washing promotion in schools is the "Three Star Approach" by UNICEF that encourages schools to take simple, inexpensive steps to ensure that students wash their hands with soap, among other hygienic requirements.
simplification: A review of 70 studies found that community-based approaches are effective at increasing hand washing in LMICs, while social marketing campaigns are less effective. One example for hand washing promotion in schools is the "Three Star Approach" by UNICEF that encourages schools to take simple, inexpensive steps to ensure that students wash their hands with soap, among other hygienic requirements.

original: When minimum standards are achieved, schools can move from one to ultimately three stars.
simplification: When minimum standards are achieved, schools can move from 1 to ultimately 3 stars.

original: Building hand washing stations can be a part of hand washing promotion campaigns that are carried out in order to reduce diseases and child mortality.
simplification: Building hand washing stations can be a part of hand washing promotion campaigns that are carried out in order to reduce diseases and childhood death.

original: Global Hand washing Day is another example of an awareness-raising campaign that is trying to achieve behavior change.As a result of the 2019-20 coronavirus pandemic, UNICEF promoted the adoption of a handwashing emoji.
simplification: Global Hand washing Day is another example of an awareness-raising campaign that is trying to achieve behavior change. As a result of the 2019-20 coronavirus pandemic, UNICEF promoted the use of a handwashing emoji.

original: Few studies have considered the overall cost effectiveness of hand washing in developing countries in relationship to DALYs averted.
simplification: Few studies have considered the overall cost effectiveness of hand washing in developing countries in relationship to DALYs averted.

original: However, one review suggests that promoting hand washing with soap is significantly more cost-effective than other water and sanitation interventions.
simplification: One review suggests that promoting hand washing with soap is significantly more cost-effective than other water and sanitation interventions.

original: The importance of hand washing for human health – particularly for people in vulnerable circumstances like mothers who had just given birth or wounded soldiers in hospitals – was first recognized in the mid 19th century by two pioneers of hand hygiene: the Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis who worked in Vienna, Austria and Florence Nightingale, the English "founder of modern nursing".
simplification: The importance of hand washing for human health, particularly for people in vulnerable circumstances, was first recognized in the mid 19th century by two pioneers of hand hygiene: the Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis and Florence Nightingale, the English "founder of modern nursing".

original: At that time most people still believed that infections were caused by foul odors called miasmas.
simplification: At that time most people still believed that infections were caused by foul smells called miasmas.

original: In the 1980s, foodborne outbreaks and healthcare-associated infections led the United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to more actively promote hand hygiene as an important way to prevent the spread of infection.
simplification: In the 1980s, foodborne outbreaks and healthcare-associated infections led the United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to more actively promote hand hygiene as an important way to prevent the spread of infection.

original: The outbreak of swine flu in 2009 and the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020 led to increased awareness in many countries of the importance of washing hands with soap to protect oneself from such infectious diseases.
simplification: The outbreak of swine flu in 2009 and the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020 led to increased awareness in many countries of the importance of washing hands with soap to protect from infectious diseases.

original: For example, posters with "correct hand washing techniques" were hung up next to hand washing sinks in public toilets and in the toilets of office buildings and airports in Germany.
simplification: Posters with "correct hand washing techniques" were hung up next to hand washing sinks in public toilets and in the toilets of office buildings and airports in Germany.

original: The phrase "washing one's hands of" something, means declaring one's unwillingness to take responsibility for the thing or share complicity in it.
simplification: The phrase "washing one's hands of" something means declaring one's unwillingness to take responsibility for the thing or share involvement in it.

original: It originates from the bible passage in Matthew where Pontius Pilate washed his hands of the decision to crucify Jesus Christ, but has become a phrase with a much wider usage in some English communities.
simplification: It originates from the bible passage in Matthew where Pontius Pilate washed his hands of the decision to crucify Jesus Christ. However, it has become a phrase with a much wider usage in some English communities.

original: In Shakespeare's Macbeth, Lady Macbeth begins to compulsively wash her hands in an attempt to cleanse an imagined stain, representing her guilty conscience regarding crimes she had committed and induced her husband to commit.
simplification: In Shakespeare's Macbeth, Lady Macbeth begins to compulsively wash her hands in an attempt to cleanse an imagined stain. This represented her guilty conscience regarding crimes she had committed and induced her husband to commit.

original: It has also been found that people, after having recalled or contemplated unethical acts, tend to wash hands more often than others, and tend to value hand washing equipment more.
simplification: It has also been found that people, after having recalled or contemplated unethical acts, tend to wash hands more often than others. They also tend to value hand washing equipment more.

original: Furthermore, those who are allowed to wash their hands after such a contemplation are less likely to engage in other "cleansing" compensatory actions, such as volunteering.
simplification: Those who are allowed to wash their hands after such a contemplation are less likely to engage in other "cleansing" compensatory actions, such as volunteering.

original: Religions prescribe hand washing for both hygienic and symbolic purposes.Symbolic hand washing, using water but no soap to wash hands, is a part of ritual hand washing featured in many religions, including Bahá'í Faith, Hinduism, tevilah and netilat yadayim in Judaism, Lavabo in Christianity, and Wudhu in Islam.Religions also prescribe hygienic hand washing, especially after certain actions.
simplification: Religions inocroporate hand washing for both hygienic and symbolic purposes. Symbolic hand washing, using water but no soap to wash hands, is a part of ritual hand washing featured in many religions, including Bahá'í Faith, Hinduism, tevilah and netilat yadayim in Judaism, Lavabo in Christianity, and Wudhu in Islam. Religions also prescribe hygienic hand washing, especially after certain actions.

original: Hinduism, Judaism and Islam mandate washing of hands after using the toilet.
simplification: Hinduism, Judaism and Islam mandate washing of hands after using the toilet.

original: And, Hinduism, Buddhism, Sikhism, Judaism and Islam mandate washing of hands before and after every meal.
simplification: Hinduism, Buddhism, Sikhism, Judaism and Islam mandate washing of hands before and after every meal.

original: Workplace hazard controls for COVID-19
simplification: Workplace hazard controls for COVID-19

original: Workplace hazard controls for COVID-19 are the application of occupational safety and health methodologies for hazard controls to the prevention of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).
simplification: Workplace hazard controls for COVID-19 are the application of occupational safety and health methods for hazard controls to the prevention of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).

original: The proper hazard controls in the workplace depend on the worksite and job task, based on a risk assessment of sources of exposure, disease severity in the community, and risk factors of individual workers who may be vulnerable to contracting COVID-19.
simplification: The proper hazard controls in the workplace depend on the worksite and job task. They are based on a risk assessment of sources of exposure, disease severity in the community, and risk factors of individual workers who may be vulnerable to contracting COVID-19.

original: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), lower exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other coworkers, for which basic infection prevention measures are recommended, including hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if they are sick, respiratory etiquette, and maintaining routine cleaning and disinfecting of the work environment.
simplification: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), lower exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other coworkers, for which basic infection prevention measures are recommended. These measures include hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if they are sick, respiratory etiquette, and maintaining routine cleaning and disinfecting of the work environment.

original: Medium exposure risk jobs include those that require frequent or close contact with people who are not known or suspected with COVID-19, but may be infected due to ongoing community transmission or international travel.
simplification: Medium exposure risk jobs include those that require frequent or close contact with people who are not suspected to have COVID-19, but may be infected due to ongoing community transmission or international travel.

original: This includes workers who have contact with the general public such as in schools, high-population-density work environments, and some high-volume retail settings.
simplification: This includes workers who have contact with the general public such as in schools, high population work environments, and some high-volume retail settings.

original: Hazard controls for this group, in addition to basic infection prevention measures, include ventilation using high-efficiency air filters, sneeze guards, and having personal protective equipment available in case a person with COVID-19 is encountered.
simplification: Hazard controls for this group include ventilation using high-efficiency air filters, sneeze guards, and having personal protective equipment available in case a person with COVID-19 is encountered.

original: OSHA considers healthcare and mortuary workers exposed to known or suspected person with COVID-19 to be at high exposure risk, which increases to very high exposure risk if workers perform aerosol-generating procedures on, or collect or handle specimens from, known or suspected person with COVID-19.
simplification: OSHA considers healthcare and mortuary workers exposed to known or suspected person with COVID-19 to be at high exposure risk. This increases to very high exposure risk if workers perform aerosol-generating procedures on, or collect or handle specimens from, known or suspected person with COVID-19.

original: Hazard controls appropriate for these workers include engineering controls such as negative pressure ventilation rooms, and personal protective equipment appropriate to the job task.
simplification: Hazard controls appropriate for these workers include engineering controls such as negative pressure ventilation rooms, and personal protective equipment appropriate to the job task.

original: COVID-19 outbreaks can have several effects within the workplace.
simplification: COVID-19 outbreaks can have many effects within the workplace.

original: Workers may be absent from work due to becoming sick, needing to care for others, or from fear of possible exposure.
simplification: Workers may be off from work due to becoming sick, needing to care for others, or from fear of possible exposure.

original: Patterns of commerce may change, both in terms of what goods are demanded, and the means of acquiring these goods (such as shopping at off-peak hours or through delivery or drive-through services).
simplification: Patterns of commerce may change, both in terms of what goods are demanded, and the means of acquiring these goods (such as shopping at off-peak hours or through delivery or drive-through services).

original: Lastly, shipments of items from geographic areas severely affected by COVID-19 may be interrupted.An infectious disease preparedness and response plan can be used to guide protective actions.
simplification: Shipments of items from geographic areas severely affected by COVID-19 may be interrupted. An infectious disease preparedness and response plan can be used to guide protective actions.

original: Plans address the levels of risk associated with various worksites and job tasks, including sources of exposure, risk factors arising from home and community settings, and risk factors of individual workers such as old age or chronic medical conditions.
simplification: Plans address the levels of risk associated with various worksites and job tasks. These include sources of exposure, risk factors coming from home and community settings, and risk factors of individual workers such as old age or chronic medical conditions.

original: Infectious disease preparedness and response plans may be subject to national or subnational recommendations.
simplification: Infectious disease preparedness and response plans may be subject to national or subnational recommendations.

original: Objectives for response to an outbreak include reducing transmission among staff, protecting people who are at higher risk for adverse health complications, maintaining business operations, and minimizing adverse effects on other entities in their supply chains.
simplification: Objectives for response to an outbreak include reducing transmission among staff, protecting people who are at higher risk for adverse health complications, maintaining business operations, and minimizing adverse effects on other entities in their supply chains.

original: The disease severity in the community where the business is located affects the responses taken.
simplification: Disease severity in the community where the business is located affects the responses taken.

original: The hierarchy of hazard controls is a framework widely used in occupational safety and health to group hazard controls by effectiveness.
simplification: The hierarchy of hazard controls is a framework widely used in occupational safety and health to group hazard controls by effectiveness.

original: Where COVID-19 hazards cannot be eliminated, the most effective controls are engineering controls, followed by administrative controls, and lastly personal protective equipment.
simplification: Where COVID-19 hazards cannot be eliminated, the most effective controls are engineering controls. These are followed by administrative controls, and lastly personal protective equipment.

original: Engineering controls involve isolating employees from work-related hazards without relying on worker behavior, and can be the most cost-effective solution to implement.
simplification: Engineering controls involve isolating employees from work-related hazards without relying on worker behavior. This can be the most cost-effective solution to implement.

original: Administrative controls are changes in work policy or procedures that require action by the worker or employer.
simplification: Administrative controls are changes in work policy or procedures that require action by the worker or employer.

original: Personal protective equipment (PPE) is considered less effective than engineering and administrative controls, but can help prevent some exposures.
simplification: Personal protective equipment (PPE) is considered less effective than engineering and administrative controls. However, it can help prevent some exposures.

original: All types of PPE must be selected based upon the hazard to the worker, properly fitted as applicable (e.g., respirators), consistently and properly worn, regularly inspected, maintained, and replaced, as necessary, and properly removed, cleaned, and stored or disposed of to avoid contamination.
simplification: All types of PPE must be selected based upon the hazard to the worker, properly fitted as applicable (e.g., respirators), consistently and properly worn, regularly inspected, maintained, and replaced. They must also be properly removed, cleaned, and stored or disposed of to avoid contamination.

original: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), lower exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other coworkers.
simplification: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), lower exposure risk jobs have minimal contact with the public and other coworkers.

original: Basic infection prevention measures recommended for all workplaces include frequent and thorough hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if they are sick, respiratory etiquette including covering coughs and sneezes, providing tissues and trash receptacles, preparing for telecommuting or staggered shifts if needed, discouraging workers from using others' tools and equipment, and maintaining routine cleaning and disinfecting of the work environment.
simplification: Basic infection prevention measures recommended for all workplaces include frequent and thorough hand washing, and encouraging workers to stay home if they are sick. Respiratory etiquette should be maintained - including covering coughs and sneezes, providing tissues and trash receptacles. Preparing for telecommuting or staggered shifts can be used if needed, discouraging workers from using others' tools and equipment, and maintaining routine cleaning and disinfecting of the work environment.

original: Prompt identification and isolation of potentially infectious individuals is a critical step in protecting workers, customers, visitors, and others at a worksite.
simplification: Quick identification and isolation of potentially infectious individuals is a critical step in protecting workers, customers, visitors, and others at a worksite.

original: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommends that employees who have symptoms of acute respiratory illness are to stay home until they are free of fever, signs of a fever, and any other symptoms for at least 24 hours without the use of fever-reducing or other symptom-altering medicines, and that sick leave policies are flexible, permit employees to stay home to care for a sick family member, and that employees are aware of these policies.
simplification: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommends that employees who have symptoms of respiratory illness are to stay home until they are free of fever, signs of a fever, and any other symptoms for at least 24 hours without the use of fever-reducing or other symptom-altering medicines. The CDC also recommend that sick leave policies are flexible, permit employees to stay home to care for a sick family member, and that employees are aware of these policies.

original: According to OSHA, medium exposure risk jobs include those that require frequent or close contact within six feet (1.8 m) of people who are not known or suspected COVID-19 patients, but may be infected with SARS-CoV-2 due to ongoing community transmission around the business location, or because the individual has recent international travel to a location with widespread COVID-19 transmission.
simplification: According to OSHA, medium exposure risk jobs include those that require frequent or close contact within six feet (1.8 m) of people who are not known or suspected COVID-19 patients. However, these people may be infected with SARS-CoV-2 due to ongoing community transmission around the business location, or because the individual has recent international travel to a location with widespread COVID-19 transmission.

original: These include workers who have contact with the general public such as in schools, high-population-density work environments, and some high-volume retail settings.Engineering controls for this and higher risk groups include installing high-efficiency air filters, increasing ventilation rates, installing physical barriers such as clear plastic sneeze guards, and installing a drive-through window for customer service.Administrative controls for this and higher risk groups include encouraging sick workers to stay at home, replacing face-to-face meetings with virtual communications, establishing staggered shifts, discontinuing nonessential travel to locations with ongoing COVID-19 outbreaks, developing emergency communications plans including a forum for answering workers’ concerns, providing workers with up-to-date education and training on COVID-19 risk factors and protective behaviors, training workers who need to use protecting clothing and equipment how to use it, providing resources and a work environment that promotes personal hygiene, requiring regular hand washing, limiting customers' and the public's access to the worksite, and posting signage about hand washing and other COVID-19 protective measures.Depending on the work task, workers with at least medium exposure risk may need to wear personal protective equipment including some combination of gloves, a gown, a face shield or face mask, or goggles.
simplification: These include workers who have contact with the general public such as in schools, high-population-density work environments, and some high-volume retail settings. Engineering controls for this and higher risk groups include installing high-efficiency air filters, increasing ventilation rates, installing physical barriers such as clear plastic sneeze guards, and installing a drive-through window for customer service. Administrative controls for this and higher risk groups include encouraging sick workers to stay at home, replacing face-to-face meetings with virtual ones, establishing staggered shifts, discontinuing nonessential travel to locations with ongoing COVID-19 outbreaks, developing emergency communications plans including a forum for answering workers’ concerns, providing workers with up-to-date education and training on COVID-19 risk factors and protective behaviors, training workers who need to use protecting clothing and equipment how to use it, providing resources and a work environment that promotes personal hygiene, requiring regular hand washing, limiting customers' and the public's access to the worksite, and posting signage about hand washing and other COVID-19 protective measures. Depending on the work task, workers with at least medium exposure risk may need to wear personal protective equipment including some combination of gloves, a gown, a face shield or face mask, or goggles.

original: Workers in this risk group rarely require use of respirators.
simplification: Workers in this risk group rarely require use of respirators.

original: If a person becomes sick on an airplane, proper controls to protect workers and other passengers include separating the sick person from others by a distance of 6 feet, designating one crew member to serve the sick person, and offering a face mask to the sick person or asking the sick person to cover their mouth and nose with tissues when coughing or sneezing.
simplification: If a person becomes sick on an airplane, proper controls to protect workers and other passengers are implemented. These include separating the sick person from others by a distance of 6 feet, designating one crew member to serve the sick person, and offering a face mask to the sick person or asking the sick person to cover their mouth and nose with tissues when coughing or sneezing.

original: Cabin crew should wear disposable medical gloves when tending to a sick traveler or touching body fluids or potentially contaminated surfaces, and possibly additional personal protective equipment if the sick traveler has fever, persistent cough, or difficulty breathing.
simplification: Cabin crew should wear medical gloves when tending to a sick traveler or touching body fluids or potentially contaminated surfaces. Poossibly, additional personal protective equipment can be worn if the sick traveler has fever, persistent cough, or difficulty breathing.

original: Gloves and other disposable items should be disposed of in a biohazard bag, and contaminated surfaces should be cleaned and disinfected afterwards. For commercial shipping, including cruise ships and other passenger vessels, hazard controls include postponing travel when sick, and self-isolating and informing the onboard medical center immediately if one develops a fever or other symptoms while on board.
simplification: Gloves and other disposable items should be disposed of in a biohazard bag, and contaminated surfaces should be cleaned and disinfected afterwards. For commercial shipping, including cruise ships and other passenger vessels, hazard controls include postponing travel when sick, and self-isolating and informing the onboard medical center immediately if one develops a fever or other symptoms while on board.

original: Ideally, medical follow-up should occur in the isolated person's cabin.For schools and childcare facilities, CDC recommends short-term closure to clean or disinfect if an infected person has been in a school building regardless of community spread.
simplification: Ideally, medical follow-up should happen in the isolated person's cabin. For schools and childcare facilities, CDC recommends short-term closure to clean or disinfect if an infected person has been in a school building regardless of community spread.

original: When there is minimal to moderate community transmission, social distancing strategies can be implemented such as canceling field trips, assemblies, and other large gatherings such as physical education or choir classes or meals in a cafeteria, increasing the space between desks, staggering arrival and dismissal times, limiting nonessential visitors, and using a separate health office location for children with flu-like symptoms.
simplification: When there is minimal to moderate community transmission, social distancing strategies can be implemented. These include canceling field trips, large gatherings, increasing the space between desks, staggering arrival and dismissal times, limiting nonessential visitors, and using a separate health office location for children with flu-like symptoms.

original: When there is substantial transmission in the local community, in addition to social distancing strategies, extended school dismissals may be considered.For law enforcement personnel performing daily routine activities, the immediate health risk is considered low by CDC.
simplification: When there is substantial transmission in the local community extended school dismissals may be considered as well as social distancing. For law enforcement personnel performing daily routine activities, the immediate health risk is considered low by CDC.

original: Law enforcement officials who must make contact with individuals confirmed or suspected to have COVID-19 are recommended to follow the same guidelines as emergency medical technicians, including proper personal protective equipment.
simplification: Law enforcement officials who must make contact with individuals confirmed or suspected to have COVID-19 are recommended to follow the same guidelines as emergency medical technicians, including proper personal protective equipment.

original: If close contact occurs during apprehension, workers should clean and disinfect their duty belt and gear prior to reuse using a household cleaning spray or wipe, and follow standard operating procedures for the containment and disposal of used PPE and for containing and laundering clothes.
simplification: If close contact occurs during arrest, workers should clean and disinfect their duty belt and gear prior to reuse using a household cleaning spray or wipe. They should also follow standard operating procedures for the containment and disposal of used PPE and for containing and laundering clothes.

original: OSHA considers certain healthcare and mortuary workers to be at high or very high categories of exposure risk.
simplification: OSHA considers certain healthcare and mortuary workers to be at high or very high categories of exposure risk.

original: High exposure risk jobs include healthcare delivery, support, laboratory, and medical transport workers who are exposed to known or suspected COVID-19 patients.
simplification: High exposure risk jobs include healthcare delivery, support, laboratory, and medical transport workers who are exposed to known or suspected COVID-19 patients.

original: Aerosol-generating procedures include intubation, cough induction procedures, bronchoscopies, some dental procedures and exams, or invasive specimen collection.
simplification: Aerosol-generating procedures include intubation, cough induction procedures, bronchoscopies, and some dental procedures and exams. Invasive specimen collection can also produce aerosol.

original: High exposure risk mortuary jobs include workers involved in preparing the bodies of people who had known or suspected cases of COVID-19 at the time of their death; these become very high exposure risk if they perform an autopsy.Additional engineering controls for these risk groups include isolation rooms for patients with known or suspected COVID-19, including when aerosol-generating procedures are performed.
simplification: High exposure risk mortuary jobs include workers involved in preparing the bodies of people who had known or suspected cases of COVID-19 at the time of their death. These become very high exposure risk if they perform an autopsy. Additional engineering controls for these risk groups include isolation rooms for patients with known or suspected COVID-19, including when aerosol-generating procedures are performed.

original: Specialized negative pressure ventilation may be appropriate in some healthcare and mortuary settings.
simplification: Specialized negative pressure ventilation may be appropriate in some healthcare and mortuary settings.

original: Specimens should be handled with Biosafety Level 3 precautions.
simplification: Specimens should be handled with Biosafety Level 3 precautions.

original: The World Health Organization (WHO) recommends that incoming patients be separated into distinct waiting areas depending on whether they are a suspected COVID-19 case.In addition to other PPE, OSHA recommends respirators for those who work within 6 feet of patients known to be, or suspected of being, infected with SARS-CoV-2, and those performing aerosol-generating procedures.
simplification: The World Health Organization (WHO) recommends that incoming patients should be separated into distinct waiting areas depending on whether they are a suspected COVID-19 case. In addition to other PPE, OSHA recommends respirators for those who work within 6 feet of patients known or suspected of being infected with SARS-CoV-2, and those performing aerosol-generating procedures.

original: In the United States, NIOSH-approved N95 filtering facepiece respirators or better must be used in the context of a comprehensive, written respiratory protection program that includes fit-testing, training, and medical exams.
simplification: In the United States, NIOSH-approved N95 filtering facepiece respirators or better must be used in the context of a comprehensive, written respiratory protection program that includes fit-testing, training, and medical exams.

original: Other types of respirators can provide greater protection and improve worker comfort.The WHO does not recommend coveralls, as COVID-19 is a respiratory disease rather than being transmitted through bodily fluids.
simplification: Other types of respirators can provide better protection and improve comfort. The WHO does not recommend coveralls, as COVID-19 is a respiratory disease rather than being transmitted through bodily fluids.

original: WHO recommends only a surgical mask for point-of-entry screening personnel.
simplification: WHO recommends only a surgical mask for point-of-entry screening personnel.

original: For those who are collecting respiratory specimens from, caring for, or transporting COVID-19 patients without any aerosol-generating procedures, WHO recommends a surgical mask, goggles, or face shield, gown, and gloves.
simplification: For those who are in contact COVID-19 patients without any aerosol-generating procedures, WHO recommends a surgical mask, goggles, or face shield, gown, and gloves.

original: If an aerosol-generating procedure is performed, the surgical mask is replaced with an N95 or FFP2 respirator.
simplification: If an aerosol-generating procedure is performed, the surgical mask is replaced with an N95 or FFP2 respirator.

original: FROM: Katherine Maher, Wikimedia Foundation CEO
simplification: FROM: Katherine Maher, Wikimedia Foundation CEO

original: TO: All Wikimedia Foundation staff
simplification: TO: All Wikimedia Foundation staff

original: SUBJECT LINE: [Covid-19] Lightening the load and preparing for the future
simplification: SUBJECT LINE: [Covid-19] Preparing for the future

original: SEND DATE/TIME: 14 March, 2020, 00:24 UTC
simplification: SEND DATE/TIME: 14 March, 2020, 00:24 UTC

original: LICENSING: CC0: No rights reserved
simplification: LICENSING: CC0: No rights reserved

original: We find ourselves in remarkable circumstances this month.
simplification: We find ourselves in unbelievable circumstances this month

original: The COVID-19 epidemic is something that makes clear our global human interconnectedness and the responsibilities we have to one another.
simplification: The COVID-19 epidemic has made us realise how connected we are across the globe, and how we have responsibilities for one another.

original: We don’t have precedent for its challenges, but we do know that our best response relies on the sort of global empathy, cooperation, and community building that sits at the heart of this organization.
simplification: Our best response for these challenge relies on the global empathy, cooperation, and community building. These values are at the heart of this organisation

original: The camaraderie and care we have seen among all of our colleagues over email, calls, and chats is a remarkable validation of the incredible humans we are fortunate enough to work with.
simplification: The friendship and care we have seen amongst our collegues over digital platforms is an amazing validation of the incredible humans we are lucky enough to work with.

original: I couldn’t be more grateful and proud to count you all as colleagues.
simplification: I couldn't be more grateful and proud to call you my collegues

original: Last week, someone shared with me their appreciation for our work.
simplification: Last week, someone shared their appreciation for our ork with me

original: They reminded me how meaningful it is for the world to be able to turn to Wikipedia right now, and what a powerful symbol it is for this critical resource to remain online and available to all.
simplification: They reminded me how valuable wikipedia is right now, and how it is such a important resource to remain online and available to everyone.

original: Your work makes this possible, whether you keep the sites stay up or our colleagues paid or our communities safe.
simplification: Whether you keep the sites up, our collegues pair, or our communities safe - your work makes this possible.

original: The world needs the information that Wikipedia provides, now more than ever.
simplification: The world needs the information that Wikipedia provides, now more than ever.

original: This is a moment in which not only what we do, but how we do it, will make a meaningful impact on the world.
simplification: Not only what we do, but how we do it, will make a meaningful impact on the world.

original: Because of the importance of this mission and your role in it, we will be making some significant adjustments to how we work together, starting this coming week.
simplification: We will be making some significant adjustments to how we work together as of this coming week

original: Adjustments to our work and schedules
simplification: Changes to our work and schedules

original: If you want to work, we support you.
simplification: We will support you if you want to work

original: Many people use work as a way of channeling their stress with the world around us.
simplification: Many people use work as a way of channeling their stress.

original: What we do can be incredibly rewarding, especially during times like this.
simplification: What we do can be very rewarding, especially during times like this.

original: Again, this is about your self-care.
simplification: This is about your self-care.

original: Our ask is that you communicate with your manager, so we know what to expect and can adjust accordingly.
simplification: We ask that you communicate with your manager, so we know what to expect and can adjust appropriately.

original: Some work is considered essential.
simplification: Some work is considered essential.

original: There are some things that we must keep doing.
simplification: There are some things that we have to keep doing.

original: The SRE, HR Ops, Trust & Safety, and Fundraising teams (among others) do critical work that may need additional support.
simplification: There are several teams that do critical work and may need additional support.

original: We’ll begin a process with all departments to assess current objectives and shift our focus to supporting what’s essential for our mission.
simplification: We’ll begin a process with all departments to assess current objectives, and change our focus to supporting what’s essential for our mission.

original: There’s plenty to do for all of us, we just will all focus on the most essential projects.
simplification: There’s plenty for all of us to do, we will just focus on the most essential projects.

original: Slowing now won’t hurt later.
simplification: Slowing down now won’t hurt later.

original: We do not plan to go “double-time to catch up” once the pandemic has passed.
simplification: We do not plan to have “double-time to catch up” once the pandemic has passed.

original: You will not be expected to work extra hours to meet deadlines which are now unrealistic.
simplification: You will not be expected to work extra hours to meet unrealistic deadlines.

original: We accept that circumstances have changed, and will work to set new targets and timelines where appropriate.
simplification: We know that circumstances have changed, and will work to set new targets and timelines where appropriate.

original: What happens with the APP (Annual Planning)?
simplification: What happens with the APP (Annual Planning)?

original: To adjust to our new reality and daily working hour expectations, we intend to adjust the timeline for the delivery of our 2020-2021 Annual Plan.
simplification: We intend to adjust the timeline for the delivery of our 2020-2021 Annual Plan.

original: Limit the length of meetings to at most one or two hour increments.
simplification: Limit the length of meetings to 1 or 2 hour increments.

original: If longer sessions are required, consider how they can be broken up over the course of several days.
simplification: If longer sessions are needed, consider how they can be broken up over the course of several days.

original: Clearly define the meeting, have an agenda, and send reading materials in advance.
simplification: Clearly define the meeting, have an objective, and send reading materials before the meeting.

original: Make video the default, with tools like Google Docs and Zoom to facilitate live collaboration and connection.
simplification: Make video the default; use tools like Google Docs and Zoom to facilitate live collaboration.

original: Have a lead to facilitate every meeting, someone to monitor the chat for questions and track the speaker list, and someone to help take notes (or do collaborative note-taking).
simplification: Have a leader to facilitate every meeting, someone to monitor the chat for questions and track the speaker list, and someone to take notes.

original: Send an email to tech support if you need a comfortable headset.
simplification: If you need a comfortable headset, email tech support

original: Use your wellness reimbursement for snacks.
simplification: Use your wellness repayment for snacks.

original: Join the #remoties channel in Slack to talk with your colleagues about distributed work
simplification: Join the #remoties channel in Slack to talk with your colleagues about work

original: The HR Operations team is looking into webinar-based ergonomics guidance to support the increase in distributed work across the Foundation.
simplification: The HR Operations team is looking into webinar-based ergonomics guidance. This will support the increase in distributed work across the Foundation.

original: This past week we asked all community grant recipients to cancel Wikimedia-funded public events, such as editathons, until the WHO declares the pandemic to be over.
simplification: This past week we have asked all of our community grant recipients to cancel Wikimedia-funded public events until the WHO declares the pandemic to be over.

original: We let them know that we understood that our request for cancellations and other restrictions could make it impossible to complete their agreed-upon grant activities and that no one would be penalized for having to delay or modify those goals.
simplification: We let them know that we understood that our request for cancellations and restrictions could make it impossible to complete their agreed-upon grant activities. We also let them know that no one would be penalized for having to delay or change those goals.

original: This coming week we will follow up with additional guidance on Wikimania and other regional and thematic community conferences.
simplification: This coming week, we will follow up with additional guidance on Wikimania and other community conferences.

original: The general sentiment from around the global community seems to be both sadness at the disruption but relief at the clarity and ability to focus on their own communities, Wikimedia and otherwise.
simplification: The general view from the global community seems to be both sadness at the disruption, but relief at the clarity and ability to focus on their own communities.

original: Going forward, the CRT is working to set up a page on Meta-Wiki to provide a space for the community to monitor the impact and follow our communications with them.
simplification: The CRT is working to set up a page on Meta-Wiki going forward. This will provide a space for the community to keep track of the impact and follow our communications with them.

original: Staying in touch around COVID-19 related issues
simplification: Staying in touch around COVID-19 related issues

original: We’ll be sending an invitation to your calendars for next Thursday, 14:00 UTC/07:00 PT for a special staff meeting.
simplification: We’ll be setting up a special staff meeting for next Thursday at 14:00 UTC/7:00 PT.

original: Thus, it is much more challenging to control the epidemic of SARS-CoV-2 than those of MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV.
simplification: It is more diffiicult to control SARS-CoV-2 than MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV.

original: These therapies include current and potential treatments with antiviral drugs, immunosuppressants, steroids, plasma from recovered patients, Chinese medicine, and psychological support.
simplification: These therapies include treatments with antiviral drugs, immunosuppressants, steroids, plasma from recovered patients, Chinese medicine, and psychological support.

original: However, the in vivo efficacy of these vaccine candidates in elderly individuals and lethal-challenge models and their protection against zoonotic virus infection have yet to be determined before a clinical study is initiated.
simplification: However, the effectiveness of the vaccines in old people need to be understood before a clinical trial starts.

original: For example, these agencies should be (1) more careful when making public announcements as every word counts to citizens and can change their attitude and decisions; (2) more sensitive and reactive to unusual information from clinics rather than waiting for formal reports from doctors or officials; (3) more restrictive to contain a potential epidemic at its early stage rather than attempting to comfort the public; and (4) more often to issue targeted and effective drills to increase the public's awareness about epidemic diseases and to test and improve the response system of the society periodically.
simplification: For example, these agencies should do the folllowing things: (1) Be more careful when making public announcements. Every word counts to citizens and can change their decisions. (2) Be more sensitive and reactive to unusual information from clinics rather than waiting for formal reports. (3) Be more restrictive at the early stages of a potential epidemic, rather than attempting to comfort the public. (4) Issue targeted drills to increase public awareness about diseases and test and improve the response system of the society from time to time.

original: This might also guide or facilitate the search for the reservoir, intermediate and amplifying animal host(s) of SARS-CoV-2, with important implications in the prevention of future spillovers.
simplification: This might also help the search for the animal hosts of SARS-CoV-2, with important messages to prevent future outbreaks.

original: A counter-proposal is in favour of a recombination between a pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoV and RaTG13 in the third wild animal species.
simplification: Another idea is in favour of a combination of a pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoV and RaTG13 in a third wild animal species.

original: In contrast to the role of camels in the transmission of MERS-CoV, the role of pangolins, if there is any, in the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 is different.
simplification: The role of camels in the transmission of MERS-CoV is different (if it exists at all) to pangolins in the transmission of SARS-CoV-2.

original: In comparison to other single-stranded RNA viruses, the estimated mutation rates of CoVs could be regarded as “moderate” to “high” with an average substitution rate being ~10-4 substitution per year per site 2, depending on the phase of CoV adaptation to novel hosts.
simplification: The estimated mutation rates of CoVs is “moderate” to “high” compared to other viruses. They have an average rate of ~10-4 substitution per year per site 2, depending on the phase of CoV adaptation to new hosts.

original: b'Drug repositioning (also known as drug repurposing, re-profiling, re-tasking or therapeutic switching) is the repurposing of an approved drug for the treatment of a different disease or medical condition than that for which it was originally developed.
simplification: Drug repositioning (also known as drug repurposing, re-profiling, re-tasking or therapeutic switching) is using an approved drug for the treatment of a different disease than it was first made for.

original: Other research directions include the development of a COVID-19 vaccine and convalescent plasma transfusion.SARS-CoV-2 has about 66 druggable proteins, each of which has multiple ligand binding sites.
simplification: Other research directions include making a COVID-19 vaccine and using blood from people who have recovered from COVID-19. SARS-CoV-2 has about 66 proteins which could be  the target of a vaccine.

original: 35 patients in Shenzhen tested negative in a median of 4 days, while the length of illness was 11 days in the 45 patients who did not receive it.
simplification: 35 patients in Shenzhen tested negative in around 4 days, the 45 patients who did not receive it took around 11 days to recover.

original: On 2 April, Germany announced that it would purchase the drug from Japan for its stockpile, and use the military to deliver the drug to university hospitals, where the drug will be used to treat COVID-19 patients.
simplification: On 2 April, Germany announced that it would buy the drug from Japan. The army will deliver the drug to hospitals. The drug will be used to treat COVID-19 patients.

original: According to the South China Morning Post, Shinzo Abe has made overtures to the Trump administration about purchasing the drug.The drug may be less effective in severe cases of illness where the virus has already multiplied.
simplification: Shinzo Abe has asked the Trump administration about purchasing the drug.The drug may not be effective in bad cases.

original: One study of lopinavir/ritonavir (Kaletra), a combination of the antivirals lopinavir and ritonavir, concluded that "no benefit was observed".
simplification: One study of lopinavir/ritonavir (Kaletra), a mix of the two drugs called lopinavir and ritonavir, showed that "no benefit was observed".

original: A team of researchers at the University of Colorado are trying to modify the drugs to find a compound that will bind with the protease of SARS-CoV-2.There are criticisms within the scientific community about directing resources to repurposing drugs specifically developed for HIV/AIDS.
simplification: A team at the University of Colorado are trying to change the drugs to  attach to SARS-CoV-2. The drugs were developed for HIV/AIDS. The scientific community has criticised the reuse of these drugs.

original: Remdesivir was created and developed by Gilead Sciences as a treatment for Ebola virus disease and Marburg virus infections . Gilead Sciences subsequently discovered that Remdesivir had antiviral activity in vitro against multiple filo-, pneumo-, paramyxo-, and corona- viruses .
simplification: Remdesivir was created by Gilead Sciences as a treatment for Ebola and Marburg virus. Gilead Sciences found that Remdesivir was useful against many viruses .

original: Some early pretrial studies suggest remdesivir may have a high genetic barrier to resistance.There are several clinical trials underway, including two conducted by Cleveland University Hospitals; one for people with moderate illness and another for those with more severe illness.
simplification: Some early studies suggest remdesivir may be difficult for a virus to become resistant to.There are several clinical trials taking place. These include two by Cleveland University Hospitals. One trial is for people who are not too ill. The other trial is for those who are more ill.

original: There are three ongoing clinical trials of intravenous vitamin C for people who are hospitalized and severely ill with COVID-19; two placebo controlled (China, Canada) and one with no control (Italy).
simplification: There are three clinical trials using vitamin C for people who are in hospital and very ill with COVID-19. Two are placebo controlled and one is not.

original: Japan's National Center for Global Health and Medicine (NCGM) is planning a clinical trial for Teijin's Alvesco (ciclesonide), an inhaled corticosteroid for asthma, for the treatment of pre-symptomatic patients infected with the novel coronavirus.
simplification: Japan's National Center for Global Health and Medicine (NCGM) is planning a clinical trial for Teijin's Alvesco (ciclesonide) to treat patients infected with coronavirus.  It is an asthma drug which you breath in.

original: A form of angiotensin-converting enzyme 2, a Phase II trial is underway with 200 patients to be recruited from severe, hospitalized cases in Denmark, Germany, and Austria to determine the effectiveness of the treatment.
simplification: A trial is taking place with 200 very ill patients in Denmark, Germany, and Austria. This trial will help to understand if the treatment works.

original: nucleic acid (DNA and RNA) (Phase I developer and vaccine candidate: Moderna, mRNA-1273)
simplification: nucleic acid (DNA and RNA) (Phase I developer and vaccine candidate: Moderna, mRNA-1273)

original: viral vector (Phase I developer and vaccine candidate: CanSino Biologics, adenovirus type 5 vector)
simplification: viral transmitter (Phase I developer and vaccine candidate: CanSino Biologics, adenovirus type 5 vector)

original: Early research to assess vaccine efficacy using COVID-19-specific animal models, such as ACE2-transgenic mice, other laboratory animals, and non-human primates, indicate a need for biosafety-level 3 containment measures for handling live viruses, and international coordination to ensure standardized safety procedures.
simplification: Early research to assess the usefulness of vaccines indicate a need for biosafety-level 3 containment measures for handling live viruses. They also need international coordination to ensure standardized safety procedures. The research used COVID-19-specific animal models, such as ACE2-transgenic mice, other laboratory animals, and non-human primates,

original: When MERS became prevalent, it was believed that existing SARS research may provide a useful template for developing vaccines and therapeutics against a MERS-CoV infection.
simplification: When MERS started, it was believed that existing research may help to develop treatments.

original: As of March 2020, there was one (DNA based) MERS vaccine which completed phase I clinical trials in humans, and three others in progress, all of which are viral-vectored vaccines, two adenoviral-vectored (ChAdOx1-MERS,  BVRS-GamVac), and one MVA-vectored (MVA-MERS-S).
simplification: As of March 2020, there was one vaccine which completed phase I clinical trials in humans. Three other vaccines were in progress. The three vaccines were all viral-vectored. Two were adenoviral-vectored (ChAdOx1-MERS,  BVRS-GamVac). One was MVA-vectored (MVA-MERS-S).

original: Social media posts have promoted a conspiracy theory claiming the virus behind COVID-19 was known and that a vaccine was already available.
simplification: Social media posts have promoted a conspiracy theory. The theory claims the virus behind COVID-19 was known. The theory also claims that a vaccine was available.

original: The patents cited by various social media posts reference existing patents for genetic sequences and vaccines for other strains of coronavirus such as the SARS coronavirus.
simplification: The social media posts reference other strains of coronavirus. They refer to existing patents for genetic sequences and vaccines.

original: On 9 April 2020, the Singaporean government announced that it had open-sourced the BlueTrace protocol used by its official government app.
simplification: On 9 April 2020, the Singaporean government announced that it had open-sourced the BlueTrace protocol used by its official government app.

original: rollout of tools to enable governments to create official privacy-preserving coronavirus tracing apps
simplification: rollout of tools to help governments to create coronavirus tracing apps which preserve privacy

original: integration of this functionality directly into iOS and AndroidGoogle and Apple plan to address the take-up and persistent surveillance problems by first distributing the system through operating system updates, and later removing it in the same way once the threat has passed.
simplification: buuilding this functionality into iOS and Android. Google and Apple plan to address problems by making the system available through operating system updates, and later removing it in the same way once the threat has passed. The problems are the take-up by users and the threat of persistent surveillance.

original: As of 17 April 2020, more than 2.24 million cases have been reported across 210 countries and territories, resulting in more than 153,000 deaths.
simplification: As of 17 April 2020, more than 2.24 million cases have been reported across 210 countries, resulting in over 153,000 deaths.

original: More than 568,000 people have recovered.The virus is primarily spread between people during close contact, often via small droplets produced by coughing, sneezing, or talking.
simplification: More than 568,000 people got better. The virus spreads between people when they are nearby. It often spreads as small droplets which come from coughing, sneezing, or talking.

original: The role of these asymptomatic carriers in transmission is not yet fully known; however, preliminary evidence suggests that they may contribute to the spread of the disease.
simplification: The role of people with no symptoms in spreading the virus is not known. Some evidence suggests they may spread the disease.

original: The proportion of infected people who do not display symptoms is currently unknown and being studied, with the Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC) reporting that 20% of all confirmed cases remained asymptomatic during their hospital stay.
simplification: The number of infected people who do not have symptoms is currently unknown. It is being studied. The Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC) report that 20% of all cases did not show symptoms during their hospital stay.

original: China's National Health Commission began including asymptomatic cases in its daily cases on 1 April; of the 166 infections on that day, 130 (78%) were asymptomatic at the time of testing.
simplification: China's National Health Commission began including peoplle with no symptoms on its daily cases on 1 April. Of the 166 infections on that day, 130 (78%) did not have symptoms at the time of testing.

original: Though the virus is not generally airborne, the National Academy of Science has suggested that bioaerosol transmission may be possible and air collectors positioned in the hallway outside of people's rooms yielded samples positive for viral RNA.
simplification: The virus is not usually found in the air. However, the National Academy of Science said transmission may be possible through the air. Air collectors positioned outside rooms gave positive samples.

original: While there are concerns it may spread via feces, this risk is believed to be low.The virus is most contagious when people are symptomatic; while spread may be possible before symptoms emerge, the risk is low.
simplification: There is a low risk it may spread via poo. The virus spreads the most when people have symptoms. The risk of spreading the virus with no symptoms is low.

original: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chlorhexidine gluconate (a surgical disinfectant), are less effective.In a Hong Kong study, saliva samples were taken a median of two days after the start of hospitalization.
simplification: Other disinfectants are less effective. In a Hong Kong study, saliva samples were taken two days after arriving in hospital.

original: In five of six patients, the first sample showed the highest viral load, and the sixth patient showed the highest viral load on the second day tested.
simplification: In five of six patients, the first sample had the most virus. The sixth patient had the most virus on the second test.

original: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus, first isolated from three people with pneumonia connected to the cluster of acute respiratory illness cases in Wuhan.
simplification: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a new type of virus which causes breathing difficulties. It was first found in three people with breathing difficulties in Wuhan.

original: All features of the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in related coronaviruses in nature.
simplification: All features of the new virus are natural.

original: Outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which bursts its protective bubble.SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.
simplification: Outside the body, the virus is killed by soap. Soap bursts its protective bubble. SARS-CoV-2 is related to SARS-CoV.

original: The lungs are the organs most affected by COVID-19 because the virus accesses host cells via the enzyme angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2), which is most abundant in the type II alveolar cells of the lungs.
simplification: The lungs are most affected by COVID-19 because the virus accesses cells using the enzyme called "angiotensin-converting enzyme 2" (ACE2). ACE2 is most abundant in the lungs.

original: The virus uses a special surface glycoprotein called a "spike" (peplomer) to connect to ACE2 and enter the host cell.
simplification: The virus uses a protein called a "spike" to connect to ACE2 and enter the host cell.

original: Acute cardiac injury was found in 12% of infected people admitted in hospital in Wuhan, China, and is more frequent in severe disease.
simplification: In Wuhan hospitals, 12% of infected people had heart injuries. Heart injury is ore likely in worse cases.

original: Rates of cardiovascular symptoms is high, owing to the systemic inflammatory response and immune system disorders during disease progression, but acute myocardial injury may also be related to ACE2 receptors in the heart.
simplification: Symptoms of heart disease are high, owing to the swelling and the body's defenses when you have the disease. Very bad heart problems may be related to ACE2 receptors in the heart.

original: A high incidence of thrombosis (31%) and venous thromboembolism (25%) have been found in ICU patients with COVID-19 infections and may be related to poor prognosis.Autopsies of people who died of COVID-19 have found diffuse alveolar damage (DAD), and lymphocyte-containing inflammatory infiltrates within the lung.
simplification: Patients with COVID-19 infections in ICU have a high rate of clotting (31%) and blocked blood vessels (25%). These conditions may be related to poor outcomes. People who died of COVID-19 had lung damage.

original: Although SARS-COV-2 has a tropism for ACE2-expressing epithelial cells of the respiratory tract, patients with severe COVID-19 have symptoms of systemic hyperinflammation.
simplification: Although SARS-COV-2 mainly affects certain cells in the lungs, patients with severe COVID-19 have symptoms swelling across the body.

original: In particular, pathogenic GM-CSF-secreting T-cells were shown to correlate with the recruitment of inflammatory IL-6-secreting monocytes and severe lung pathology in COVID-19 patients.
simplification: In particular, diseased T-cells correlated with lung damage in COVID-19 patients.

original: Lymphocytic infiltrates have also been reported at autopsy.
simplification: Lymphocytic infiltrates have also been reported at autopsy.

original: The test is typically done on respiratory samples obtained by a nasopharyngeal swab; however, a nasal swab or sputum sample may also be used.
simplification: Swabs of the nose, swabs of the nose and throat, or spit may be tested.

original: Blood tests can be used, but these require two blood samples taken two weeks apart and the results have little immediate value.
simplification: Blood tests require two blood samples taken two weeks apart. The results of a blood test are not useful straight away.

original: Chinese scientists were able to isolate a strain of the coronavirus and publish the genetic sequence so laboratories across the world could independently develop polymerase chain reaction (PCR) tests to detect infection by the virus.
simplification: Chinese scientists isolated the coronavirus and published the genetic sequence. Laboratories across the world developed tests to detect the virus.

original: As of 4 April 2020, antibody tests (which may detect active infections and whether a person had been infected in the past) were in development, but not yet widely used.
simplification: As of 4 April 2020, antibody tests were in development, but not widely used. These tests may detect infections and whether a person had been infected in the past.

original: The FDA in the United States approved the first point-of-care test on 21 March 2020 for use at the end of that month.Diagnostic guidelines released by Zhongnan Hospital of Wuhan University suggested methods for detecting infections based upon clinical features and epidemiological risk.
simplification: The FDA in the United States approved the first test on 21 March 2020 for use at the end of that month. Zhongnan Hospital of Wuhan University suggested ways to detect the virus based on clinical features and risk.

original: Bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacities with a peripheral, asymmetric and posterior distribution are common in early infection.
simplification: double-sided whole lung opacities with an uneven and rear distribution are common in early infection.

original: Subpleural dominance, crazy paving (lobular septal thickening with variable alveolar filling), and consolidation may appear as the disease progresses.
simplification: Other patterns may appear as the disease progresses.

original: healing pneumonia: organisation of exudates in alveolar cavities and pulmonary interstitial fibrosis
simplification: healing pneumonia: fluid on the lungs and thinckening of the tissue around the lungs

original: Blood: disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC); leukoerythroblastic reaction
simplification: Blood: disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC); leukoerythroblastic reaction

original: There is evidence that hydroxychloroquine may have anti-cytokine storm properties.Tocilizumab has been included in treatment guidelines by China's National Health Commission after a small study was completed.
simplification: There is evidence that hydroxychloroquine may help  prevent cytokine storm. Tocilizumab has been included in treatment guidelines by China's National Health Commission after a small study was completed.

original: It is undergoing a phase 2 non randomised test at the national level in Italy after showing positive results in people with severe disease.
simplification: It is undergoing a phase 2 trial in Italy after showing positive results in people with severe disease.

original: Combined with a serum ferritin blood test to identify cytokine storms, it is meant to counter such developments, which are thought to be the cause of death in some affected people.
simplification: Combined with a blood test to identify cytokine storms, it is meant to prevent death in some people.

original: The interleukin-6 receptor antagonist was approved by the FDA based on retrospective case studies for treatment of steroid refractory cytokine release syndrome induced by a different cause, CAR T cell therapy, in 2017.
simplification: The drug was approved by the FDA based on case studies for treating cytokine storm from a different cause, in 2017.

original: To date, there is no randomised, controlled evidence that tocilizumab is an efficacious treatment for CRS.
simplification: To date, there is no evidence that tocilizumab is an effective treatment for CRS.

original: Transferring purified and concentrated antibodies produced by the immune systems of those who have recovered from COVID-19 to people who need them is being investigated as a non-vaccine method of passive immunisation.
simplification: Transferring COVID-19 antibodies to people who need them is being investigated as a method of making people immune.

original: This strategy was tried for SARS with inconclusive results.
simplification: This was tried for SARS, but the results were not conclusive.

original: Viral neutralisation is the anticipated mechanism of action by which passive antibody therapy can mediate defence against SARS-CoV-2.
simplification: Passive antibody therapy is expected to help the body defend against SARS-CoV-2 by stopping the virus from working.

original: Other mechanisms however, such as antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity and/or phagocytosis, may be possible.
simplification: Other mechanisms may also be possible.

original: Other forms of passive antibody therapy, for example, using manufactured monoclonal antibodies, are in development.
simplification: Other forms of passive antibody therapy, for example, using  antibodies made from a single cell, are in development.

original: Production of convalescent serum, which consists of the liquid portion of the blood from recovered patients and contains antibodies specific to this virus, could be increased for quicker deployment.
simplification: Production of drug could be increased for quicker deployment. The drug is made of the liquid portion of the blood from recovered patients and contains antibodies specific to this virus.

original: Coronavirus diseases, a group of closely related syndromes
simplification: Coronavirus diseases, a group of closely related syndromes

original: Li Wenliang, a doctor at Central Hospital of Wuhan, who later contracted and died of COVID-19 after raising awareness of the spread of the virus.
simplification: Li Wenliang was a doctor at Central Hospital of Wuhan. He later contracted and died of COVID-19 after raising awareness of the spread of the virus.

original: Of the early cluster of cases reported in December 2019, two-thirds were found to have a link with the market.
simplification: Two-thirds of the early cases were found to have a link with the market.

original: In China, estimates for the death-to-case ratio decreased from 17.3% (for those with symptom onset 1–10 January 2020) to 0.7% (for those with symptom onset after 1 February 2020).Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which reflects the percent of diagnosed people who die from a disease, and the infection fatality rate (IFR), which reflects the percent of infected (diagnosed and undiagnosed) who die from a disease.
simplification: In China, estimates of deaths decreased. Another measure is the percent of diagnosed people who die from a disease called the case fatality rate (CFR). Yet another measure is the percent of infected (diagnosed and undiagnosed) who die from a disease called the infection fatality rate (IFR).

original: Maciej Boni of Penn State University stated, "Left unchecked, infectious outbreaks typically plateau and then start to decline when the disease runs out of available hosts.
