simplification: Humans appear to be capable of spreading the virus to some other animals.

original: The study failed to find evidence of viral replication in pigs, ducks, and chickens.
simplification: The study failed to find evidence of viral replication in pigs, ducks, and chickens.

original: No medications or vaccine is approved to treat the disease.
simplification: No medications or vaccine is approved to treat the disease.

original: International research on vaccines and medicines in COVID-19 are underway by government organisations, academic groups and industry researchers.
simplification: International research on vaccines and medicines in COVID-19 are underway by government organisations, academic groups and industry researchers.

original: In March, the World Health Organization initiated the "SOLIDARITY Trial" to assess treatment effects of four existing antiviral compounds with the most promise of efficacy.
simplification: In March, the World Health Organization begun the "SOLIDARITY Trial" to assess which of four existing antiviral compounds had the most promising therapeutic effect.

original: There is no available vaccine, but various agencies are actively developing vaccine candidates.
simplification: Although there is no available vaccines, various agencies are actively developing vaccine candidates.

original: Previous work on SARS-CoV is being utilised because SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 both use the ACE2 receptor to enter human cells.
simplification: Since both SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 use the ACE2 receptor to enter human cells, previous work on SARS-CoV is being used.

original: There are three vaccination strategies being investigated.
simplification: Three vaccination strategies are being investigated.

original: First, researchers aim to build a whole virus vaccine.
simplification: First, researchers aim to build a whole virus vaccine.

original: The use of such a virus, be it inactive or dead, aims to elicit a prompt immune response of the human body to a new infection with COVID-19.
simplification: The use of such virus, inactive or dead, aims to prompt immune response of the human body against a new COVID-19 infection.

original: A second strategy, subunit vaccines, aims to create a vaccine that sensitises the immune system to certain subunits of the virus.
simplification: A second strategy involves using subunit vaccines. It aims to create a vaccine that sensitises the immune system to certain subunit of the virus.

original: In the case of SARS-CoV-2, such research focuses on the S-spike protein that helps the virus intrude the ACE2 enzyme receptor.
simplification: In SARS-CoV-2 cases, such research focuses on the S-spike protein that helps viruses invade the ACE2 enzyme receptor.

original: A third strategy is that of the nucleic acid vaccines (DNA or RNA vaccines, a novel technique for creating a vaccination).
simplification: DNA or RNA vaccines are a novel technique for creating a vaccination is the third strategy.

original: Experimental vaccines from any of these strategies would have to be tested for safety and efficacy.On 16 March 2020, the first clinical trial of a vaccine started with four volunteers in Seattle.
simplification: Experimental vaccines from any of these strategies would have to be tested for safety and benefit. On 16 March 2020, the first clinical trial of a vaccine started with four volunteers in Seattle.

original: The vaccine contains a harmless genetic code copied from the virus that causes the disease.Antibody dependent enhancement has been suggested as a potential challenge for vaccine development for SARS-COV-2, but this is controversial.
simplification: The vaccine contains a harmless genetic code copied from the virus that causes the disease. Although this is controversial, Antibody dependent enhancement has been suggested as a potential challenge for vaccine development for SARS-COV-2.

original: There are more than 300 active clinical trials underway as of April 2020.
simplification: As of April 2020, there are more than 300 active clinical trials underway.

original: Seven trials were evaluating already approved treatments for malaria, including four studies on hydroxychloroquine or chloroquine.
simplification: Seven trials were evaluating already approved treatments for malaria. This includes four studies on hydroxychloroquine or chloroquine.

original: Repurposed antiviral drugs make up most of the Chinese research, with nine phase III trials on remdesivir across several countries due to report by the end of April.
simplification: Repurposed antiviral drugs make up most of the Chinese research. Nine phase III trials on remdesivir across several countries due to report by the end of April.

original: A dynamic review of clinical development for COVID-19 vaccine and drug candidates was in place, as of April 2020.Several existing antiviral medications are being evaluated for treatment of COVID-19, including remdesivir, chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine, lopinavir/ritonavir and lopinavir/ritonavir combined with interferon beta.
simplification: As of April 2019, a review of clinical development for COVID-19 vaccine and drug candidatewas in place. Several existing antiviral medications are being evaluated for treatment of COVID-19. Treatments include, remdesivir, choloroquine, hydroxychloroquine, lopinavir/ritonavir and lopinavir/ritonavir combined with interferon beta.

original: There is tentative evidence for efficacy by remdesivir, as of March 2020.
simplification: As of March, 2020, there is a preliminary evidence that remdesivir works.

original: Clinical improvement was observed in patients treated with compassionate-use remdesivir.
simplification: Patients were observed to improve clinically when treated with compassionate use remdesivir.

original: Phase III clinical trials are being conducted in the US, China and Italy.Chloroquine, previously used to treat malaria, was studied in China in February 2020, with preliminary results.
simplification: Phase III clinical trials are being conducted in the US, China and Italy. In february 2020, Choloroquine, previously used to treat maria was studied in China with preliminary results.

original: However, there are calls for peer review of the research.
simplification: However, there are calls for peer review of the research.

original: Korean and Chinese Health Authorities recommend the use of chloroquine.
simplification: Korean and Chinese Health Authorities recommend the use of chloroquine.

original: However, the Wuhan Institute of Virology, while recommending a daily dose of one gram, notes that twice that dose is highly dangerous and could be lethal.
simplification: Although the Wuhan Institute of Virology recommends a daily dose of one gram, it warn that twice that dose is highly dangerous.

original: At least 52 thousand deaths were linked to COVID-19, the disease caused by the coronavirus.
simplification: At least 52 thousand deaths were linked to COVID-19, which was caused by coronavirus.

original: The milestone came the same day Malawi confirmed its first coronavirus infections and Zambia had its first coronavirus-related death.
simplification: Zambia had its first coronavirus related death. The milestone came on the same day when Malawi confirmed its first coronavirus case.

original: North Korea claimed, as of Thursday, it was one of the few countries remaining free of coronavirus infections.
simplification: North Korea claimed that it was one of the few countries remaining free of coronavirus infections as of Thursday.

original: By yesterday, the World Health Organization reported 1,051,635 confirmed cases, including 79,332 cases in the twenty four hours preceding 10 a.m. Central European Time (0800 UTC) on April 4.
simplification: By yesterday, the World Health Organization reported 1,051,635 confirmed cases. 79,332 cases were confirmed in the twenty-four hours preceding 10 a.m. Central European Time (0800 UTC) on April 4.

original: In the United States, over 244 thousand coronavirus cases were recorded, linking to at least 5,900 deaths.
simplification: At least 5,900 deaths were linked to the 244,00 coronavirus cases recorded in the United States.

original: CBS News reported, citing Johns Hopkins University data, there were over 1,000 US deaths on Wednesday caused by coronavirus infections.
simplification: CBS News reported that according to Johns Hopkins University data, there were over 1,000 coronavirus related deaths in the US on Wednesday.

original: Around the world, countries announced stricter measures to inhibit the disease from spreading.
simplification: Stricter measures to prevent the spread of the disease was announced across the world.

original: On Thursday, Sergei Sobyanin, the mayor of Moscow, extended the city lockdown to May 1.
simplification: The mayor of Moscow, Sergei Sobyanin, extended the city lockdown to May 1 on Thursday.

original: Nationally, President Vladimir Putin declared Russians would continue to be paid without going to work until April 30.
simplification: President Vladimir Putin announced that Russians would continue to be paid without going to work until April 30 nationally.

original: The parliament of Portugal voted to extend the national state of emergency by 15 days; the vote passed with 215 votes in favor, ten abstentions, and one vote against.
simplification: The vote to extend the national state of emergency by 15 days was passed by a majority of votes in the Parliament of Portugal.

original: Saudi Arabia extended curfews in the holy cities of Mecca and Medina to last the entire day; previously, the curfew was only in effect between 3 p.m. and 6 a.m.
simplification: Saudi Arabia extended the curfew in the holy cities of Mecca and Medina to last an entire day. Previously, the curfew was only between 3.p.m and 6 a.m.

original: Thailand planned to implement a curfew between 10 p.m. and 4 a.m.
simplification: Thailand had planned to implement a curfew between 10 p.m. and 4 a.m.

original: The governor of Ohio, Mike DeWine, announced the state had extended its stay-at-home order until May 1.
simplification: The governor of Ohio, Mike DeWine, announced that the state has extended its stay-at-home order until May 1.

original: Stores in Australia lower toilet paper limits per transaction
simplification: The stores in Australia have limited the number of toilet paper rolls that can be bought per purchase.

original: On Sunday and Saturday evening, Australian store chains Woolworths and Coles lowered their purchase restrictions on toilet paper to two and one package per transaction in all stores on national level, respectively.
simplification: Australian store chains Woolworth and Coles lowered their purchase restriction on toilet paper in all their stores nationally. Woolworths restricts to two packages while Coles restricts to one package per transaction.

original: ALDI also introduced a one-pack limit, on Monday.
simplification: On Monday, ALDI introduced a one-pack limit.

original: These limitations were posted as messages on the checkouts, and on the chains' Facebook pages.
simplification: Messages of these limitations were posted on the checkout and the chains' Facebook pages.

original: The Thursday edition of NT News, a daily printed in Darwin, included an eight-page insert meant to be cut up and used as toilet paper.
simplification: The Thursday edition of NTW News in Darwin, included an eight-page insert to be cut up and used as toilet paper.

original: The stores were originally reluctant to impose restrictions, according to a report from ABC Australia on March 3 in which they said they had no plans to introduce restrictions on the purchases.
simplification: According to a report from ABC Australia on the March 3rd, the stores were originally reluctant to impose restriction. They had no plans to introduce limitations on the purchases.

original: Russell Zimmerman added that other products are also in high demand, including masks, sanitiser, dried goods, handwash and flour.
simplification: Russell Zimmerman added other products, such as masks, sanitiser, dried goods, handwash and flour are also high in demand.

original: Similarly, outside of Australia, on Sunday evening online British supermarket Ocado was observed limiting purchases of Andres toilet paper to two 12-roll packs.
simplification: Similarly, outside of Australia, on Sunday evening online British supermarket Ocado was observed limiting purchases of Andres toilet paper to two 12-roll packs.

original: World Health Organization declares COVID-19 pandemic
simplification: World Health Organization declares COVID-19 outbreak.

original: On Wednesday, the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the ongoing outbreak of COVID-19 — the disease caused by coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 — to be a pandemic.
simplification: The World Health Organization (WHO) declared the ongoing outbreak of COVID 19, caused by coronavirus SARS CoV-2, to be a global event.

original: Although the word "pandemic" only refers to how widely a disease has spread, not how dangerous specific cases are, the WHO noted the need to drive governments to action:
simplification: The WHO noted the need to drive government to action as the word ‘’pandemic’’ only refers to how widely a disease has spread. It does not specify how dangerous the disease can be.

original: All countries can still change the course of this pandemic.
simplification: All countries can still change the course of this global outbreak.

original: If countries detect, test, treat, isolate, trace and mobilize their people in the response, said Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, the Director-General of the WHO.
simplification: If countries detect, test, treat, isolate, trace and mobilize their people in the response, said Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, the Director-General of the WHO.

original: We are deeply concerned both by the alarming levels of spread and severity and by the alarming levels of inaction.
simplification: We are deeply concerned by the alarming spread, severity and the lack of response.

original: According to Dr. Tom Frieden, formerly the director of the United States' Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the pandemic is "unprecedented."
simplification: According to Dr. Tom Frieden, the former director of the United States' Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the pandemic is "unprecedented."

original: He said, in remarks published by CNN in February, "other than influenza, no other respiratory virus has been tracked from emergence to continuous global spread."
simplification: In remarks published by CNN is February, he said,’’ Other than influenza, no other respiratory virus has been tracked from emergence to continuous global spread’’

original: Ghebreyesus expressed a similar view, saying "we have never before seen a pandemic sparked by a coronavirus."
simplification: Ghebreyesus expressed a similar view, saying "we have never before seen a pandemic sparked by a coronavirus."

original: He continued, "and we have never before seen a pandemic that can be controlled at the same time."
simplification: He continued, "and we have never before seen a pandemic that can be controlled at the same time."

original: The new status as a pandemic follows the WHO's decision in January to declare the outbreak a public health emergency of international concern.
simplification: The new status following WHO’s decision in January is to declare the outbreak a public health emergency of international concern.

original: The United States' National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease's director, Dr. Anthony Fauci, said of the outbreak, "bottom line, it's going to get worse."
simplification: The United States' National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease's director, Dr. Anthony Fauci, commented on the outbreak, "bottom line, it's going to get worse."

original: As of Thursday, Associated Press reported there were at least 126,000 cases of COVID-19 worldwide, resulting in over 4,600 deaths.
simplification: As of Thursday, Associated press reported that there were at least 4,600 deaths of the 126,00 COVID-19 cases worldwide.

original: The virus that caused the outbreak is known as SARS-CoV-2, a newly discovered virus closely related to bat coronaviruses, pangolin coronaviruses, and SARS-CoV.The earliest known person with symptoms was later discovered to have fallen ill on 1 December 2019, and that person did not have visible connections with the later wet market cluster.
simplification: The SARS-CoV-2 outbreak is caused by a SARS-CoV and a newly discovered virus known as pangolin coronaviruses. It is closely related to bat coronaviruses. The earliest known person with symptoms was discovered to have fallen ill on 1 Dec 2019. However, they did not have any visible connections with the wet market cluster.

original: Of the early cluster of cases reported in December 2019, two-thirds were found to have a link with the market.
simplification: Two-thirds of the cases reported in early December 2019, were found to have a link with the market.

original: On 13 March 2020, an unverified report from the South China Morning Post suggested that a case traced back to 17 November 2019, in a 55-year-old from Hubei province, may have been the first.On 26 February 2020, the WHO reported that, as new cases reportedly declined in China but suddenly increased in Italy, Iran, and South Korea, the number of new cases outside China had exceeded the number of new cases within China for the first time.
simplification: A Chinese Newspaper released an unverified report of the first case. It may be traced back to a 55-year-old from Hubei province on17 November 2019. On 26 February 2020, WHO reported a sudden increase of new cases in Italy, Iran and South Korea while it declined in China. The number of new cases outside China exceeded the number of new cases within China for the first time.

original: There may be substantial underreporting of cases, particularly among those with milder symptoms.
simplification: There may have been a considerable amount of unreported cases, especially among those with milder symptoms.

original: By 26 February, relatively few cases had been reported among youths, with those 19 and under making up 2.4% of cases worldwide.The United Kingdom's chief scientific adviser, Patrick Vallance, estimated that 60% of the British population would need to become infected before effective herd immunity could be achieved.
simplification: By 26 February, there were only a few cases reported among youths. Those under the age of 19 made up 2.4% of cases worldwide. The United Kingdom's Chief Scientific Advisor estimated that effective herd immunity can only be achieved if 60% of the British population were to become infected.

original: Cases refers to the number of people who have been tested for COVID-19, and whose test has been confirmed positive according to official protocols.
simplification: According to official protocols, cases refers to the number of people who have been tested and been confirmed positive for COVID-19.

original: As of 23 March, no country had tested more than 3% of its population, and many countries have had official policies not to test those with only mild symptoms, such as Italy, the Netherlands, Spain, and Switzerland.
simplification: Several countries such as Italy, Netherlands, Spain and Switzerland have official policies to not test those with only mild symptoms. No countries had more than 3% of its population tested as of 23rd March.

original: A study published on 16 March found that in China, up to 23 January, an estimated 86% of COVID-19 infections had not been detected, and that these undocumented infections were the infection source for 79% of documented cases.
simplification: According to a study published on 16 March, an estimated 86% of COVID-19 cases were not detected and documented in China. Undocumented cases were the source of infection for 79% of documented cases up to 23 January.

original: A statistical analysis published 30 March estimated that numbers of infections in Italy were considerably greater than the reported cases.
simplification: A study published on 30th March estimated that number of infections in Italy were much greater than the reported cases.

original: The initial estimates of the basic reproduction number (R0) for COVID-19 were 1.4 to 2.4.
simplification: The initial estimates of the basic reproduction number (R0) for COVID-19 were 1.4 to 2.4.

original: A study published by the US Center for Disease Control and Prevention has concluded that it may be 5.7.
simplification: A study published by the US Centre for Disease Control and Prevention has concluded that it may be 5.7.

original: Most people with COVID-19 recover.
simplification: Most people with COVID-19 will recover.

original: For those who do not, the time from development of symptoms to death has been between 6 and 41 days, with the most common being 14 days.
simplification: For those who do not recover, death commonly happens within 14 days. The time from the development of symptoms to death can range from 6 and 41 days.

original: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 97,000 deaths had been attributed to COVID-19.
simplification: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 97,000 deaths are associated with COVID-19.

original: In China, as of 5 February about 80% of deaths were in those over 60, and 75% had pre-existing health conditions including cardiovascular diseases and diabetes.Official tallies of deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic generally refer to dead people who tested positive for COVID according to official protocols.
simplification: As of 5 February, 80% of deaths in China occurred among those over 60 years old. 75% of them had pre-existing health conditions such as heart diseases and diabetes. According to the official protocols, official reports of death from COVID-19 refers to people who died after being tested positive for COVID-19.

original: The number of true fatalities from COVID-19 may be much higher, as it may not include people who die without testing - e.g. at home, in nursing homes, etc.
simplification: The number of true deaths from COVID-19 may be much higher as it may not include people who die without being tested. For example, people who die at home or nursing homes.

original: Partial data from Italy found that the number of excess deaths during the pandemic exceeded the official COVID death tally by a factor of 4-5x.
simplification: Partial data from Italy found that the number of surplus deaths during the pandemic exceeded the official COVID death tally. It exceeds by a factor of 4-5x.

original: The number varies by region.
simplification: The number varies by region.

original: These statistics are not timebound and follow a specific population from infection through case resolution.
simplification: These statistics are not time restricted. They follow a specific population from infection through reovery.

original: A number of academics have attempted to calculate these numbers for specific populations.
simplification: A number of academics have tried to calculate these numbers for specific populations.

original: The University of Oxford's Centre for Evidence-Based Medicine estimates that the infection fatality rate for the pandemic as a whole is between 0.1% and 0.39%.
simplification: The University of Oxford's Centre for Evidence-Based Medicine estimates that the infection death rate for the pandemic is between 0.1% and 0.39%.

original: The upper estimate of this range is consistent with the results from the first random testing for COVID-19 in Germany, and a statistical study analysing the impact of testing on CFR estimates.
simplification: The upper estimate of this range is consistent with the results from the first random testing for COVID-19 in Germany, and a statistical study analysing the impact of testing on CFR estimates.

original: The WHO asserts that the pandemic can be controlled.
simplification: The WHO believes that the pandemic can be controlled.

original: The peak and ultimate duration of the outbreak are uncertain and may differ by location.
simplification: The peak and the total duration of the outbreak are uncertain and may differ by location.

original: According to the Imperial College study led by Neil Ferguson, physical distancing and other measures will be required "until a vaccine becomes available (potentially 18 months or more)".
simplification: According to the Imperial College study led by Neil Ferguson, physical distancing and other measures will be required until a vaccine becomes available which could be potentially 18 months or more.

original: William Schaffner of Vanderbilt University stated, "I think it's unlikely that this coronavirus—because it's so readily transmissible—will disappear completely" and it "might turn into a seasonal disease, making a comeback every year".
simplification: William Schaffner of Vanderbilt University stated it is unlikely that this coronavirus will disappear completely since it is so readily spread. It could become a seasonal disease, where is appear every year.

original: The virulence of the comeback would depend on herd immunity and the extent of mutation.
simplification: The severity of the comeback would depend on herd immunity and the extent of mutation.

original: Symptoms of COVID-19 can be relatively non-specific and infected people may be asymptomatic.
simplification: Symptoms of COVID-19 can be non-specific and infected people may not have symptoms.

original: The two most common symptoms are fever (88%) and dry cough (68%).
simplification: The two most common symptoms are fever (88%) and dry cough (68%).

original: Less common symptoms include fatigue, respiratory sputum production (phlegm), loss of the sense of smell, shortness of breath, muscle and joint pain, sore throat, headache, chills, vomiting, hemoptysis, diarrhea, or cyanosis.The WHO states that approximately one person in six becomes seriously ill and has difficulty breathing.
simplification: Less common symptoms include tiredness, phlegm production in the lungs, loss of the sense of smell, difficulty breathing, muscle and join pain, sore throat, headache, chills, vomiting, coughing up blood, diarrhoea or bluish discolouration of the skin. The WHO states that approximately one in six people become seriously ill and have difficulty breathing.

original: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) lists emergency symptoms as difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, sudden confusion, difficulty waking, and bluish face or lips; immediate medical attention is advised if these symptoms are present.Further development of the disease can lead to severe pneumonia, acute respiratory distress syndrome, sepsis, septic shock and death.
simplification: The U.S. Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) lists emergency symptoms as difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, sudden confusion, difficulty waking, and bluish face or lips. Immediate medical attention is advised if these symptoms are present. As the disease progresses, it can lead to severe pneumonia, acute respiratory distress syndrome, blood infection, septic shock and death.

original: Some of those infected may be asymptomatic, with no clinical symptoms but with test results that confirm infection, so researchers have issued advice that those with close contact to confirmed infected people should be closely monitored and examined to rule out infection.
simplification: Some of those infected may not have any symptoms but may test positive for the infection. Researchers advice that those with close contact with infected people should be closely monitored and examined to rule out infection.

original: Chinese estimates of the asymptomatic ratio range from few to 44%.
simplification: Chinese estimates that the ratio of those who are asymptomatic range from few to 44%.

original: The usual incubation period (the time between infection and symptom onset) ranges from one to 14 days; it is most commonly five days.As an example of uncertainty, the estimate of the fraction of people with COVID-19 who lost their sense of smell was initially 30% and later fell to 15%.
simplification: The typical incubation period, the time between infection and start of symptoms, is most commonly fiver days but can range from one to fourteen days. As an example of uncertainty, the estimate of the fraction of people with COVID-19 who lost their sense of smell fell to 15% from initial 30%.

original: Some details about how the disease is spread are still being determined.
simplification: Some details about how the disease is spread are still being analysed.

original: The disease is believed to be primarily spread during close contact and by small droplets produced during coughing, sneezing, or talking; with close contact being within 1 to 2 metres (3 to 6 feet).
simplification: The disease is believed to be mainly spread during close contact of within 1 to 2 metres or 3 to 6 feet and by small droplets produced during coughing, sneezing or talking.

original: Studies have found that an uncovered coughing can lead to droplets travelling up to 4.5 metres (15 feet) to 8.2 metres (27 feet).
simplification: Studies have found that an uncovered coughing can lead to droplets travelling up to 4.5 metres (15 feet) to 8.2 metres (27 feet).

original: Some have proposed that the virus may also be transmitted by small droplets that stay for more prolonged periods in the air, that may be generated during speech.Respiratory droplets may also be produced during breathing out, including when talking, though the virus is not generally airborne.
simplification: Some have suggested that the virus may be spread by small droplets present in the air generated during speech. Although the virus is not airborne, respiratory droplets can be produced during breathing out and talking.

original: The droplets can land in the mouths or noses of people who are nearby or possibly be inhaled into the lungs.
simplification: The droplets can land in the mouths or noses of people who are nearby or possibly breathed into the lungs.

original: Some medical procedures such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) may cause respiratory secretions to be aerosolized and thus result in airborne spread.
simplification: Some medical procedures such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) may cause secretions to be aerosolized and result in an airborne spread.

original: It may also spread when one touches a contaminated surface, including skin, and then touches their eyes, nose, or mouth.
simplification: It may also spread when one touches an infected surface, including the skin, and then touches their eyes, nose or mouth.

original: While there are concerns it may spread by faeces, this risk is believed to be low.
simplification: Although there are concerns of spreading through faeces, the risk is believed to be low.

original: The Government of China denied the possibility of faecal-oral transmission of SARS-CoV-2.The virus is most contagious during the first three days after onset of symptoms, although spread may be possible before symptoms appear and in later stages of the disease.
simplification: The Government of China denied the possibility of SARS-CoV-2 transmission through faeces. Although the spread of the virus may possible before symptoms appear and in later stages of the disease, it is most contagious during the first three days once the symptoms show.

original: People have tested positive for the disease up to three days before onset of symptoms suggesting transmission is possible before developing significant symptoms.
simplification: Transmission is possible before developing symptoms as people have been test positive for the disease up to three days even before symptoms are noticeable.

original: Only few reports of laboratory-confirmed asymptomatic cases exist, but asymptomatic transmission has been identified by some countries during contact tracing investigations.
simplification: Only few reports of laboratory-confirmed asymptomatic cases exist. However, asymptomatic transmission has been indentified by some countries during contact tracing investigations.

original: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) states that while it is not entirely clear how easily the disease spreads, one person generally infects two to three others.The virus survives for hours to days on surfaces.
simplification: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) states that while it is not entirely clear how easily the disease spreads, one person generally infects two to three others. The virus survives for hours to days on surfaces.

original: Specifically, the virus was found to be detectable for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and 304 stainless steel, for one day on cardboard, and for up to four hours on copper.
simplification: Specifically, the virus was found to be detectable for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and 304 stainless steel, for one day on cardboard, and for up to four hours on copper.

original: This, however, varies based on the humidity and temperature.Pets and other animals have tested positive for COVID-19.
simplification: This, however, varies based on the humidity and temperature. Pets and other animals have tested positive for COVID-19.

original: There is no evidence animals can pass the virus on to humans, though British authorities advise washing one's hands after contact with animals, like after contact with other surfaces infected people could have touched.
simplification: Although, there is no evidence to suggest that animal can pass the virus on to human, British authorities advise washing one’s hands after coming into contact with animals, like after contact with other surfaces infected people could have touched.

original: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel virus, first isolated from three people with pneumonia connected to the cluster of acute respiratory illness cases in Wuhan.
simplification: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel virus that was first isolated from three people with pneumonia connected the group of lung infection cases in Wuhan.

original: All features of the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in related coronaviruses in nature.Outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which dissolves its protective envelope.SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.
simplification: All features of the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus is seen in related coronaviruses in nature. Outside the human body, household soap dissolves its protective envelopes and kills the virus. SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.

original: When it is no longer possible to contain the spread of the disease, efforts then move to the mitigation stage: measures are taken to slow the spread and mitigate its effects on the healthcare system and society.
simplification: When it is no longer possible to control the spread of the disease, effort then move to the mitigation stage. Measures are taken to slow the spread and reduce it effects on the healthcare system and society.

original: A combination of both containment and mitigation measures may be undertaken at the same time.
simplification: A combination measures to confine and ease the spread may be undertaken at the same time.

original: Suppression requires more extreme measures so as to reverse the pandemic by reducing the basic reproduction number to less than 1.Part of managing an infectious disease outbreak is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as flattening the epidemic curve.
simplification: Suppression requires more extreme measures to reverse the pandemic by reversing the basic reproduction number to less than 1. Part of managing an outbreak is flatten the epidemic curve by trying to decrease the epidemic peak.

original: This decreases the risk of health services being overwhelmed and provides more time for vaccines and treatments to be developed.
simplification: This decreases the risk of health services being overwhelmed. It also provides more time for vaccines and treatments to be developed.

original: Non-pharmaceutical interventions that may manage the outbreak include personal preventive measures, such as hand hygiene, wearing face-masks, and self-quarantine; community measures aimed at physical distancing such as closing schools and cancelling mass gathering events; community engagement to encourage acceptance and participation in such interventions; as well as environmental measures such surface cleaning.More drastic actions aimed at containing the outbreak were taken in China once the severity of the outbreak became apparent, such as quarantining entire cities and imposing strict travel bans.
simplification: Personal preventive measures such as hand hygiene, wearing face masks and self-quarantine are non-pharmaceutical measures that may manage the outbreak. Community measure includes physical distancing such closing schools, cancelling mass gathering event and encouraging community engagement and acceptance by participating in such interventions. Environmental measure includes cleaning surfaces. More drastic actions such as quarantining entire cities and imposing strict travel bans to contain the outbreak were taken in China once the severity of the outbreak became obvious.

original: Other countries also adopted a variety of measures aimed at limiting the spread of the virus.
simplification: Other countries also adopted a variety of measures aimed at limiting the spread of the virus.

original: South Korea introduced mass screening and localized quarantines, and issued alerts on the movements of infected individuals.
simplification: South Korea introduced mass screening and localized quarantines. It has also issued alerts on the movement of infected individuals.

original: Singapore provided financial support for those infected who quarantined themselves and imposed large fines for those who failed to do so.
simplification: Singapore provided financial support for infected individual under quarantine and imposed large fined for those who failed to do so.

original: Taiwan increased face mask production and penalized hoarding of medical supplies.Simulations for Great Britain and the United States show that mitigation (slowing but not stopping epidemic spread) and suppression (reversing epidemic growth) have major challenges.
simplification: Taiwan increased the production of face mask and penalised hoarding of medical supplies. Simulation for Great Britain and the United states show that the slowing efforts of the epidemic spread and reversing epidemic growth have major challenges.

original: Optimal mitigation policies might reduce peak healthcare demand by 2/3 and deaths by half, but still result in hundreds of thousands of deaths and health systems being overwhelmed.
simplification: Optimal policies for slowing the spread might reduce peak healthcare demand by 2/3 and deaths by half. However, it may still result in hundreds of thousands of deaths and health systems being overwhelmed.

original: Suppression can be preferred but needs to be maintained for as long as the virus is circulating in the human population (or until a vaccine becomes available, if that comes first), as transmission otherwise quickly rebounds when measures are relaxed.
simplification: Suppression can be preferred but needs to maintain for as long as the virus is circulating in the human population or until a vaccine becomes available. Otherwise, transmission rebounds quickly when measures are relaxed.

original: Long-term intervention to suppress the pandemic causes social and economic costs.
simplification: Long-term interventions to suppress the pandemic causes social and economic costs.

original: There are no specific antiviral medications approved for COVID-19, but development efforts are underway, including testing of existing medications.
simplification: There are no specific antiviral medications approved for COVID-19. However, development effort are underway, including testing of existing medications.

original: Taking over-the-counter cold medications, drinking fluids, and resting may help alleviate symptoms.
simplification: Taking over-the-counter cold medications, drinking fluids, and resting may help relieve symptoms.

original: Depending on the severity, oxygen therapy, intravenous fluids, and breathing support may be required.
simplification: Oxygen therapy, intravenous fluids and breathing support may be required depending on the severity.

original: The use of steroids may worsen outcomes.
simplification: Steroid use may worsen the outcome.

original: Several compounds that were previously approved for treatment of other viral diseases are being investigated for use in treating COVID-19.
simplification: Several compounds that were previously approved for treatment of other viral diseases are being investigated for use in treating COVID-19.

original: The WHO also stated that some "traditional and home remedies" can provide relief of the symptoms caused by SARS-CoV-19.
simplification: The WHO also stated that some "traditional and home remedies" can provide relief of the symptoms caused by SARS-CoV-19.

original: Increasing capacity and adapting healthcare for the needs of COVID-19 patients is described by the WHO as a fundamental outbreak response measure.
simplification: The WHO described increasing capacity and adapting healthcare for needs of COVID-19 patients is a important outbreak response measure.

original: There are various theories about where the very first case (the so-called patient zero) may have originated.
simplification: There are various theories about where the very first case of patient zero may have originated.

original: The first known case of the novel coronavirus may trace back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan, Hubei, China.
simplification: The first known case of the novel coronavirus may trace back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan, Hubei, China.

original: Within a month, the number of coronavirus cases in Hubei gradually increased.
simplification: The number of coronaviruses cases in Hubei gradually increased within a month.

original: On 30 December, a group of doctors at Wuhan Central Hospital alerted their colleagues of a "SARS-like coronavirus".
simplification: A group of doctors at the Wuhan Central Hospital alerted their colleagues of a ‘’SARS-like coronavirus’’ on 30 December.

original: The Wuhan Municipal Health Commission later released a public notice on 31 December and informed the WHO.
simplification: The Wuhan Municipal Health Commission later released a public notice on 31 December and informed the WHO.

original: Enough cases of unknown pneumonia had been reported to health authorities in Wuhan to trigger an investigation in early January.During the early stages of the outbreak, the number of cases doubled approximately every seven and a half days.
simplification: There were sufficient cases of unknown pneumonia reported health authorities in Wuhan to trigger an investigation in early January. During the early stages of the outbreak, the number of cases doubled every seven and a half days.

original: In early and mid-January 2020, the virus spread to other Chinese provinces, helped by the Chinese New Year migration and Wuhan being a transport hub and major rail interchange.
simplification: The Chinese New Year migration and Wuhan being a transport hub and major rail interchange, helped the spread of the virus to other Chinese provinces in early and mid-January 2020.

original: On 20 January, China reported nearly 140 new cases in one day, including two people in Beijing and one in Shenzhen.
simplification: On 20 January, China reported nearly 140 new cases in one day, including two people in Beijing and one in Shenzhen.

original: Around 200 countries and territories have had at least one case.
simplification: Around 200 countries and territories have had at least one case.

original: Due to the pandemic in Europe, many countries in the Schengen Area have restricted free movement and set up border controls.
simplification: Many countries in the Schengen Area have restricted free movement and set up border controls due to the pandemic in Europe.

original: The first confirmed case of COVID-19 has been traced back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan; one unconfirmed report suggests the earliest case was on 17 November.
simplification: The first confirmed case of COVID-19 has been traced back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan; one unconfirmed report suggests the earliest case was on 17 November.

original: Doctor Zhang Jixian observed a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 26 December, upon which her hospital informed Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
simplification: Doctor Zhang Jixian observed a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 26 December. Her hospital later reported to Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.

original: Initial genetic testing of patient samples on 27 December 2019 indicated the presence of a SARS-like coronavirus.
simplification: Initial genetic testing of patient samples on 27 December 2019 indicated the presence of a SARS-like coronavirus.

original: A public notice was released by Wuhan Municipal Health Commission on 31 December.
simplification: A public notice was released by Wuhan Municipal Health Commission on 31 December.

original: The WHO was informed on the same day.
simplification: The WHO was informed on the same day.

original: As these notifications occurred, doctors in Wuhan were warned by police for "spreading rumours" about the outbreak.
simplification: As these reports happened, doctors in Wuhan were warned by the police for ''spreading rumours'' about the outbreak.

original: The Chinese National Health Commission initially claimed that there was no "clear evidence" of human-to-human transmission.
simplification: The Chinese National Health Commission initially claimed that there was no "clear evidence" of human-to-human transmission.

original: In late January, the Chinese government launched a radical campaign later described by the Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping as a "people's war" to contain the spread of the virus.
simplification: The Chinese government launched a radical campaign in late January, later described by the Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping as a "people's war" to contain the spread of the virus.

original: Private vehicle use was banned in the city.
simplification: Private vehicle use was banned in the city.

original: Chinese New Year (25 January) celebrations were cancelled in many places.
simplification: Chinese New Year (25 January) celebrations were cancelled in many places.

original: The authorities also announced the construction of a temporary hospital, Huoshenshan Hospital, which was completed in 10 days.
simplification: The authorities also announced the construction of a temporary hospital, Huoshenshan Hospital, which was completed in 10 days.

original: Another hospital was built afterwards, Leishenshan Hospital, to handle additional patients.
simplification: Another hospital was built afterwards, Leishenshan Hospital, to handle additional patients.

original: Universities and schools around the country were also closed.
simplification: Universities and schools around the country were also closed.

original: The regions of Hong Kong and Macau instituted several measures, particularly in regard to schools and universities.
simplification: Particularly in regard to schools and universities, the regions of Hong Kong and Macau implemented several measures.

original: Remote working measures were instituted in several Chinese regions.
simplification: Remote working measures were adopted in several Chinese regions.

original: Travel restrictions were enacted in and outside of Hubei.
simplification: Travel restrictions were implemented in and outside of Hubei.

original: Public transport was modified, and museums throughout China were temporarily closed.
simplification: Public transport was altered, and museums throughout China were temporarily closed.

original: Those who wish to enter China will have to apply for visas in Chinese embassies or consulates.
simplification: Those who wish to enter China will have to apply for visas in Chinese embassies or consulates.

original: COVID-19 was confirmed to have spread to South Korea on 20 January 2020 from China.
simplification: COVID-19 was confirmed to have spread to South Korea on 20 January 2020 from China.

original: Dubai, Sydney, and Melbourne were also reported as popular destinations for people travelling from Wuhan.
simplification: Dubai, Sydney, and Melbourne were also reported as popular destinations for people travelling from Wuhan.

original: Bali was reported as least able among the 20 most popular destination cities in terms of preparedness, while cities in Australia were considered most able.Australia released its Emergency Response Plan for Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) on 7 February.
simplification: Bali was reported as least able among the 20 most popular destination cities in terms of preparedness. Australia was considered the most able, where it released its Emergency Response Plan for Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) on 7 February.

original: It stated that much was yet to be discovered about COVID-19, and that Australia would emphasize border control and communication in its response to the pandemic.
simplification: It stated that much was yet to be discovered about COVID-19. Australia would emphasize border control and communication in its response to the pandemic.

original: On 21 March, a human biosecurity emergency was declared in Australia.
simplification: A human biosecurity emergency was declared in Australia on 21 March.

original: Owing to the effective quarantine of public transport in Wuhan and Hubei, several countries have planned to evacuate their citizens and diplomatic staff from the area, primarily through chartered flights of the home nation, with Chinese authorities providing clearance.
simplification: Due to the effective quarantine of public transport in Wuhan and Hubei, several countries have planned to evacuate their citizens and diplomatic staff from the area. They will be evacuated through chartered flights of the home nation, with Chinese authorities providing clearance.

original: Canada, the United States, Japan, India, Sri Lanka, Australia, France, Argentina, Germany, and Thailand were among the first to plan the evacuation of their citizens.
simplification: Canada, the United States, Japan, India, Sri Lanka, Australia, France, Argentina, Germany, and Thailand were among the first to plan the evacuation of their citizens.

original: Pakistan has said that it will not be evacuating any citizens from China.
simplification: Pakistan has said that it will not be evacuating any citizens from China.

original: On 7 February, Brazil evacuated 34 Brazilians or family members in addition to four Poles, a Chinese person, and an Indian citizen.
simplification: Brazil evacuated 34 Brazilians or family members in addition to four Poles, a Chinese person, and an Indian citizen on 7 February.

original: The citizens of Poland, China, and India deplaned in Poland, where the Brazilian plane made a stopover before following its route to Brazil.
simplification: The citizens of Poland, China, and India deplaned in Poland. The Brazilian plane made a stopover before following its route to Brazil.

original: Brazilian citizens who went to Wuhan were quarantined at a military base near Brasília.
simplification: Brazilian citizens who went to Wuhan were quarantined at a military base near Brasília.

original: On the same day, 215 Canadians (176 from the first plane, and 39 from a second plane chartered by the U.S. government) were evacuated from Wuhan to CFB Trenton to be quarantined for two weeks.
simplification: On the same day, 215 Canadians chartered by the U.S. government, were evacuated from Wuhan to CFB Trenton to be quarantined for two weeks.

original: On 11 February, another plane of 185 Canadians from Wuhan landed at CFB Trenton.
simplification: Another plane of 185 Canadians from Wuhan landed at BFB Trenton on 11 February.

original: Australian authorities evacuated 277 citizens on 3 and 4 February to the Christmas Island Detention Centre, which had been repurposed as a quarantine facility, where they remained for 14 days.
simplification: Australian authorities evacuated 277 citizens on 3 and 4 February to the Christmas Island Detention Centre for 14 days. It had been repurposed as a quarantine facility.

original: A New Zealand evacuation flight arrived in Auckland on 5 February; its passengers (including some from Australia and the Pacific) were quarantined at a naval base in Whangaparoa, north of Auckland.
simplification: A New Zealand evacuation flight arrived in Auckland on 5 February. Its passengers, which included some from Australia and the Pacific were quarantined at a naval base in Whangaparoa, north of Auckland.

original: On 15 February, the United States announced that it would evacuate Americans aboard the cruise ship Diamond Princess.
simplification: The United States announced on 15 February, that it would evacuate Americans aboard the cruise ship Diamond Princess

original: On 21 February, a plane carrying 129 Canadian passengers who had been evacuated from Diamond Princess landed in Trenton, Ontario.
simplification: On 21 February, a plane carrying 129 Canadian passengers who had been evacuated from Diamond Princess landed in Trenton, Ontario.

original: In early March, the Indian government began evacuating its citizens from Iran.On 14 March a South African Airways aircraft chartered by the South African Government repatriated 112 South African citizens.
simplification: In early March, the Indian government began evacuating its citizens from Iran. On 14 March, a South African Airways aircraft chartered by its Government repatriated 112 South African citizens.

original: Medical screening was performed prior to departure, and four South Africans who were showing signs of coronavirus were left behind to mitigate risk.
simplification: South Africans who showed signs of coronavirus during a pre-departure medical screening were left behind to mitigate the risk.

original: Only South Africans who tested negative were repatriated.
simplification: Only South Africans who test negative were allowed back into their country.

original: Test results cleared all the South Africans, including the flight crew, pilots, hotel staff, police and soldiers involved in the humanitarian mission who, as a precautionary measure, all remained under observation and in quarantine for a 14-day period at The Ranch Resort.
simplification: Test results cleared all the South Africans, including the flight crew, pilots, hotel staff, police and soldiers involved in the humanitarian mission. They all remained under observation and in quarantine for 14-days at The Ranch Resort as a precautionary measure.

original: On 20 March, the United States began to partially withdrawal its troops from Iraq due to the pandemic.
simplification: The United States began to partially withdrawal its troops from Iraq due to the pandemic on 20 March.

original: On 5 February, the Chinese foreign ministry stated that 21 countries (including Belarus, Pakistan, Trinidad and Tobago, Egypt, and Iran) had sent aid to China.
simplification: On 5 February, the Chinese foreign ministry stated that 21 countries, including Belarus, Pakistan, Trinidad and Tobago, Egypt, and Iran had sent aid to China.

original: Some Chinese students at American universities joined together to help send aid to virus-stricken parts of China, with a joint group in the greater Chicago area reportedly managing to send 50,000 N95 masks to hospitals in the Hubei province on 30 January.The humanitarian aid organization Direct Relief, in coordination with FedEx, sent 200,000 face masks along with other personal protective equipment, including gloves and gowns, by emergency airlift to the Wuhan Union Hospital by 30 January.
simplification: Some Chinese students at American universities joined together to help send aid of virus-stricken parts of China. A joint group in the greater Chicago area managed to send 50,000 N95 masks to hospitals in the Hubei province on 30 January. Direct Relief, a humanitarian aid organisation coordinated with FedEx sent 200,000 face masks along with other personal protective equipment, including gloves and gowns, via an emergency airlift to the Wuhan Union Hospital by 30 January.

original: On 5 February, Bill and Melinda Gates announced a $100 million donation to the WHO to fund vaccine research and treatment efforts along with protecting "at-risk populations in Africa and South Asia".
simplification: On 5 February, Bill and Melinda Gates announced a $100 million donation to the WHO to fund vaccine research and treatment efforts along with protecting "at-risk populations in Africa and South Asia".

original: Interaksyon reported that the Chinese government donated 200,000 masks to the Philippines on 6 February, after Senator Richard Gordon shipped 3.16 million masks to Wuhan.
simplification: After Senator Richard Gordon shipped 3.16 million masks to Wuhan, Interaksyon reported that the Chinese government donated 200,000 masks to the Philippines on 6 February.

original: On 19 February, the Singapore Red Cross announced that it would send $2.26 million worth of aid to China.
simplification: On 19 February, the Singapore Red Cross announced that it would send $2.26 million worth of aid to China.

original: Japan donated one million face masks to Wuhan, Turkey dispatched medical equipment, Russia sent more than 13 tonnes of medical supplies to Wuhan, Malaysia announced a donation of 18 million medical gloves to China, Germany delivered various medical supplies including 10,000 Hazmat suits, and the United States donated 17.8 tons of medical supplies to China and promised an additional $100 million in financial support to affected countries.After cases in China seemed to stabilize, the country has been sending aid to various nations hit by the pandemic.
simplification: Japan donated one million face masks to Wuhan while Turkey dispatched medical equipment and Russia sent more than 13 tonnes of medical supplies to Wuhan.  Malaysia announced a donation of 18 million medical gloves to China while Germany delivered various medical supplies including 10,000 Hazmat suits, and the United States donated 17.8 tons of medical supplies to China and promised an additional $100 million in financial support to affected countries. After cases in China stabilized, the country has been sending aid to various nations hit by the pandemic.

original: In March, China, Cuba and Russia sent medical supplies and experts to help Italy deal with its coronavirus outbreak.
simplification: China, Cuba and Russia sent medical supplies and experts to help Italy deal with its coronavirus outbreak in March.

original: Businessman Jack Ma sent 1.1 million testing kits, 6 million face masks, and 60,000 protective suits to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia for distribution by the African Union.
simplification: Businessman Jack Ma sent 1.1 million testing kits, 6 million face masks, and 60,000 protective suits to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia which was distributed by the African Union.

original: He later sent 5,000 testing kits, 100,000 face masks and 5 ventilators to Panama.
simplification: He later sent 5,000 testing kits, 100,000 face masks and 5 ventilators to Panama.

original: Ma also donated medical supplies to Canada.The Netherlands, Spain, Turkey, Georgia, and the Czech Republic expressed their concerns over Chinese-made masks and test kits.
simplification: Ma also donated medical supplies to Canada. The Netherlands, Spain, Turkey, Georgia, and the Czech Republic expressed their concerns over Chinese-made masks and test kits.

original: For instance, Spain withdrew 58,000 Chinese-made coronavirus testing kits with an accuracy rate of just 30%, meanwhile, the Netherlands recalled 600,000 Chinese face masks which were defective.
simplification: For example, Spain withdrew 58,000 Chinese-made coronavirus testing kits with an accuracy rate of just 30%. Netherlands recalled 600,000 Chinese face masks which were defective.

original: Belgium recalled 100,000 unusable masks, thought to be from China, but were in fact from Colombia.
simplification: Belgium recalled 100,000 unusable masks, which were thought to be from China, but were in fact from Colombia.

original: On the other hand, Chinese aid has been well-received in parts of Latin America and Africa.On 2 April, the World Bank launched emergency support operations for developing countries.
simplification: On the other hand, aid from China has been well-received in parts of Latin America and Africa. On 2 April, the World Bank launched emergency support operations for developing countries.

original: The WHO has commended the efforts of Chinese authorities in managing and containing the epidemic.
simplification: The WHO has commended the efforts of Chinese authorities in managing and containing the epidemic.

original: The WHO noted the contrast between the 2002–2004 SARS outbreak, where Chinese authorities were accused of secrecy that impeded prevention and containment efforts, and the current crisis where the central government "has provided regular updates to avoid panic ahead of Lunar New Year holidays".
simplification: The WHO noted the difference between the 2002–2004 SARS outbreak, where Chinese authorities were accused of secrecy that slowed the prevention and containment efforts. In contrast, the central government has provided regular updates avoid panic ahead of Lunar New Year holidays for the current crisis.

original: On 11 March, the WHO declared the coronavirus outbreak a pandemic.
simplification: On 11 March, the WHO declared the coronavirus outbreak a pandemic.

original: The Director-General said that the WHO was "deeply concerned both by the alarming levels of spread and severity, and by the alarming levels of inaction".The WHO has faced significant criticism for what is seen as inadequate handling of the pandemic, including the late declaration of a public health emergency and the classification of the virus as a pandemic.
simplification: The Director-General expressed that WHO was deeply concerned by the alarming levels of spread and severity, and by the alarming levels of inaction. The WHO has faced significant criticism for the late declaration of a public health emergency and the classification of the virus as a pandemic, which is seen as an inadequate handling of the pandemic.

original: The backlash included a petition for the WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom to tender his resignation, signed by 733,000 people as of 6 April.
simplification: As of 6 April, the backlash included a petition signed by 733,000 people for the WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom to resign.

original: On 26 March 2020, dozens of UN human rights experts emphasized respecting the rights of every individual during the COVID-19 pandemic.
simplification: On 26 March 2020, dozens of UN human rights experts emphasized respecting the rights of every individual during the COVID-19 pandemic.

original: The expert group stated that everyone is entitled to life-saving interventions and the government holds this responsibility.
simplification: The expert group stated that everyone is entitled to life-saving interventions and the government holds this responsibility.

original: The group stressed that the lack of resources or health insurance should never serve as a justification for discrimination against a specific group.
simplification: The group stressed that the lack of resources or health insurance should never serve as a justification for discrimination against a specific group.

original: The experts underscored that every individual has the right to health, including people with disabilities, belonging to minority groups, older people, internally displaced people, the homeless, those living in extremely poor conditions, people in detention, as well as refugees and other unspecified groups in need of government support.
simplification: The experts underscored that every person has the right to health. It including people with disabilities, belonging to minority groups, older people, internally displaced people, the homeless, those living in extremely poor conditions, people in detention, as well as refugees and other unspecified groups in need of government support.

original: International governmental organizations are addressing the economic and social impacts of the COVID-19 crisis.
simplification: The economic and social impacts of the COVID-19 crisis are addressed by International governmental organizations.

original: The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development has launched a platform to provide timely and comprehensive information on policy responses in countries around the world, as well as viewpoints and advice.
simplification: The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development has launched a platform to provide timely and comprehensive information on policy responses in countries around the world. it provides viewpoints and advice as well.

original: From policies to strengthen health systems and the world economy to addressing the effects of lockdown and restrictions on travel, the digital hub includes a Country Policy Tracker, and aims to help countries learn from each other and to facilitate a co-ordinated global response to the coronavirus challenge.
simplification: The digital hub includes a country policy tracker which aims to help countries learn from each other and to facilitate a co-ordinated global response to the coronavirus challenge.

original: The Chinese government has been criticized by the United States, UK Minister for the Cabinet Office Michael Gove, and Brazil President Jair Bolsonaro's son Eduardo Bolsonaro for its handling of the pandemic, which began in the Chinese province of Hubei.
simplification: The Chinese government has been criticized by the United States, UK Minister for the Cabinet Office Michael Gove, and Brazil President Jair Bolsonaro's son Eduardo Bolsonaro for how it handled the pandemic as it began in the Chinese province of Hubei.

original: A number of provincial-level administrators of the Communist Party of China (CPC) were dismissed over their handling of the quarantine efforts in Central China, a sign of discontent with the political establishment's response to the outbreak in those regions.
simplification: A number of administrators of the Communist Party of China (CPC) at province level were dismissed over their handling of the quarantine efforts in Central China. It was a sign of discontent with the political establishment's response to the outbreak in those regions.

original: Some commentators believe that this move was intended to protect Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping from the public's anger over the coronavirus outbreak.
simplification: Some commentators believe that this move was intended to protect Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping from the public's anger over the coronavirus outbreak.

original: Some Chinese officials, e.g. Zhao Lijian rejected an earlier acknowledgement of the coronavirus outbreak starting in Wuhan, in favour of conspiracy theories about the COVID-19 originating from the U.S. or Italy.
simplification: In favour of conspiracy theories about the COVID-19 originating from the U.S. or Italy, some Chinese officials like Zhao Lijian rejected an earlier acknowledgement of the coronavirus outbreak starting in Wuhan.

original: The Daily Beast obtained a U.S. government cable outlining a communications stratagem with apparent origins in the National Security Council, with the strategy being quoted as "Everything is about China.
simplification: The Daily Beast obtained a U.S. government cable outlining a communications stratagem with apparent origins in the National Security Council. The strategy was quoted as "Everything is about China.

original: We're being told to try and get this messaging out in any way possible, including press conferences and television appearances."Outlets such as Politico, Foreign Policy, and Bloomberg have claimed that China's efforts to send aid to virus-stricken countries is part of a propaganda push for global influence.
simplification: We're being told to get this message out in any way including through press conferences and television appearances."Outlets such as Politico, Foreign Policy, and Bloomberg have claimed that China's efforts to send aid to virus-stricken countries is part of a propaganda push for global influence.''

original: China has also called for the US to lift its sanctions off of Syria, Venezuela and Iran, while reportedly sending aid to the latter two countries.
simplification: China has also called for the US to lift its sanctions off of Syria, Venezuela and Iran. It also reported sending aid to the latter two countries.

original: Jack Ma's donation of 100,000 masks to Cuba was blocked by US sanctions on 3 April.
simplification: Jack Ma's donation of 100,000 masks to Cuba was blocked by US sanctions on 3 April.

original: US authorities have also been accused of diverting aid meant for other nations to their own country.
simplification: US authorities have also been accused of diverting aid meant for other nations to their own country.

original: And there have been mask-related disputes reported between other countries, such as Germany, Austria and Switzerland; and the Czech Republic and Italy.
simplification: And there have been mask-related disputes reported between other countries, such as Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Czech Republic and Italy.

original: In addition, Turkey seized hundreds of ventilators destined for Spain.
simplification: In addition, Turkey confiscated hundreds of ventilators destined for Spain.

original: In early March, the Italian government criticized the European Union's lack of solidarity with coronavirus-affected Italy.
simplification: In early March, the Italian government criticized the European Union's lack of support for coronavirus-affected Italy.

original: Maurizio Massari, Italy's ambassador to the EU, said that "Only China responded bilaterally.
simplification: Maurizio Massari, Italy's ambassador to the EU, said that only China responded bilaterally.

original: Certainly, this is not a good sign of European solidarity."
simplification: Certainly, this isn't a good sign of European unity.

original: On 22 March, after a phone call with Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte, Russian president Vladimir Putin arranged the Russian army to send military medics, special disinfection vehicles, and other medical equipment to Italy.
simplification: On 22 March, after a phone call with Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte, Russian president Vladimir Putin arranged the Russian army to send military medics, special disinfection vehicles, and other medical equipment to Italy.

original: The source accused Russia of embarking on a "geopolitical and diplomatic" charm offensive.
simplification: The source accused Russia of embarking on a "geopolitical and diplomatic" charm offensive.

original: Russia also sent a cargo plane with medical aid to the United States.
simplification: Russia also sent a cargo plane with medical aid to the United States.

original: The South Korean society was initially polarized on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.
simplification: The South Korean society was divided on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.

original: Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.The pandemic has allowed countries to pass emergency legislation in response.
simplification: Many Koreans signed petitions either holding Moon accountable for the goverment mishandling the outbreak or praising his response. .The pandemic has allowed countries to pass emergency legislation in response.

original: Some commentators have expressed concerns that it could allow governments to strengthen their grip on power.
simplification: Some commentators have raised concern that it could allow goverment to strenghten their hold on power.

original: In Hungary, its parliament voted to allow the prime minister, Viktor Orbán, to rule by decree indefinitely, suspend parliament as well as elections and punish those deemed to have spread false information about the virus and the government's handling of the crisis.
simplification: In Hungary, its parliament voted to allow the prime minister, Viktor Orbán, to rule by decree indefinitely. He will be able to suspend parliament as well as elections and punish those deemed to have spread false information about the virus and the government's handling of the crisis.

original: The coronavirus outbreak has been blamed for several instances of supply shortages, stemming from globally increased usage of equipment to fight the outbreaks, panic buying, and disruption to factory and logistic operations.
simplification: Increased usage of equipment to fight the outbreak, panic buying and disruption to factor and logistic have been blamed for the supply shortages during cornavirus outbreak.

original: The United States Food and Drug Administration has issued warnings about shortages of drugs and medical equipment due to increased consumer demand and supplier disruption.
simplification: Due to increased consumer demand and supplier disruption, the United States Food and Drug Administration has issued warning about shortages of drugs and medical equipment.

original: Several localities also witnessed panic buying that led to shelves being cleared of grocery essentials such as food, toilet paper, and bottled water, inducing supply shortages.
simplification: Several localities saw panic buying buying of essential groceries. Food, toilet paper and bottle water were cleared out of shelves causing supply shortages.

original: The technology industry in particular has been warning about delays to shipments of electronic goods.
simplification: The technology industry has been warning about delays to shipments of electronic goods.

original: According to WHO director-general Tedros Adhanom, the demand for personal protection equipment has risen 100-fold.
simplification: According to WHO director-general Tedros Adhanom, the demand for personal protection equipment has risen by 100 times.

original: This demand has led to the increase in prices of up to twenty times the normal price and also induced delays on the supply of medical items for four to six months.
simplification: This demand has led to the increase in prices of upto twenty times the normal price. It has also cause delays on the supply of medical item for four to six months.

original: It has also caused a shortage of personal protective equipment worldwide, with the WHO warning that this will endanger health workers.
simplification: It has also caused a shortage of personal protective equipments worldwide. The WHO has warned that this will put healthworker at risk.

original: In Australia, the pandemic provided a new opportunity for daigou shoppers to sell Australian products into China.
simplification: In Australia, the pandemic provided a new opportunity for daigou shoppers to sell Australian products into China.

original: The activity has created a shortage of baby formula in some supermarkets and was subsequently banned by the Australian government.Despite the high prevalence of COVID-19 cases in Northern Italy and the Wuhan region, and the ensuing high demand for food products, both areas have been spared from acute food shortages.
simplification: The activity has created a shortage of baby formula in some supermarket. The australian givertment has banned the baby formula. Despite the high number of COVID-19 cases in Northern Italy and Wuhan region, both areas have escaped from any food shortages.

original: Measures by China and Italy against the hoarding and illicit trade of critical products have been successful, avoiding acute food shortages that were anticipated in Europe as well as in North America.
simplification: Measures by China and Italy against hoarding and illlicit trade of essential products have been successful. Acute food shortages were avoided.

original: Northern Italy with its significant agricultural production has not seen a large reduction, but prices may increase according to industry representatives.
simplification: Northern Italy has not seen a large reduction with its agricultural production. However, prices may increase according to industry representative.

original: Empty food shelves were only encountered temporarily, even in Wuhan city, while Chinese government officials released pork reserves to assure sufficient nourishment of the population.
simplification: Even in Wuhan city, empty food shelves only lasted temporarily. The Chinese government official release pork reserves to ensure everyone has enough food.

original: Similar laws exist in Italy requiring food producers to keep reserves for such emergencies.
simplification: Similar laws requiring food producers to keep reserves for such emergencies existed in Italy.

original: Damage to the global economy has been felt in China: according to a media report on 16 March, the economy in China was very hard hit in the first two months of 2020 due to the measures taken by the government to curtail virus spread, and retail sales plunged 20.5%.
simplification: According to a media report on 16 March, the economy in China was hit hard in the first two months of 2020. Due to the measures taken by the government to reduce virus spread, retail sales have fallen by 20.5%. Therefore, China has felt the damage to the global economy.

original: As mainland China is a major economy and manufacturing hub, the viral outbreak has been seen to pose a major destabilizing threat to the global economy.
simplification: The viral outbreak has been seen to pose to a major threat for destabilizing to the global economy as mainland china is a major economy nad macnufacturing hub.

original: Agathe Demarais of the Economist Intelligence Unit has forecast that markets will remain volatile until a clearer image emerges on potential outcomes.
simplification: Agathe Demarais of the Economist Intelligence Unit has predicted that markets will remain unstable until a clearer image on potential outcomes is found.

original: In January 2020, some analysts estimated that the economic fallout of the epidemic on global growth could surpass that of the 2002–2004 SARS outbreak.
simplification: In January 2020, some analyst estimated that the economic fallout of the pandemic on global growth could surpass that of the 2002-2004 SARS outbreak.

original: One estimate from an expert at Washington University in St. Louis gave a $300+ billion impact on the world's supply chain that could last up to two years.
simplification: An expert at Washington University in St.Louis gave an estimate of $300+ billion impact on the world's supply chain. This could be expected to last up to two years.

original: The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) reportedly "scrambled" after a steep decline in oil prices due to lower demand from China.
